results.description:
New England Irish Set Dancers is a group for any and all who are interested in Irish Set Dancing. All skill levels are welcome. No partner needed. Set dancing is Irish folk dancing (social dancing) and is a fun way to exercise, socialize, and meet other Irish Set Dancers.  

Group leaders and dance instructors from various parts of New England started this group as a way to share their local set dancing events and class information with others who are looking to find locations to set dance or those who are interested in lessons. Dance locations are in the Greater Boston area of Massachusetts (including Wakefield and Quincy), Southern New Hampshire (Durham), and Rhode Island (Cranston). We welcome other set dancing groups / locations in the New England area to join as Organizers. [It is free for members to join; Organizers pay a fee that is shared by all locations.] 

Read more about the group on the About page: 
http://www.meetup.com/New-England-Irish-Set... 

New to Meetup? See article about signing up for New England Irish Set Dancers:
http://www.meetup.com/New-England-Irish-Set-Dancers/pages/New_to_Meetup%3F_Find_some_general_info_here

results.description:
Hi There!

We are a group of lively, fun, friendly, kind and talented people. Please join us!

We have exciting news!  Being a member of Goodstitches, YOU are now part of a HUGE network of needle artist spanning the GLOBE!

Goodstitches.com 

What does that mean? 

In early February we started working on Goodstitches. We have opened up 270+ Meetup groups in 7 countries!  We have Meetups in the USA, Canada, Australia, England, Wales, Ireland and Scotland!  Needle artists from all over the globe have joined Goodstitches before we have even had our FIRST event!  That is what we were hoping for!

We know that YOU want ACTIVE groups in your local area.  We know that you want to meet people in your area for friendship and to work and learn together.  We are making that possible!

Want to be a local host of your group or an event organizer of your local group?  WE want you!  Leaders of local groups are needed and we are providing ALL the tools-videos, pictures, forms and online training to help you make your local group successful!

Goodstitches.com 

What is the purpose of Goodstitches? It is a way that people in the quilting, sewing and needle art community can connect. By being a part of this group, you are going to be able to find others and share knowledge, ask questions, find supplies, post your pictures on the meetup site and much more!

You will also be able to sell your used quilting machine, sewing machine, parts of your stash or tools that you no longer need. 

You will be able find or post a job in the needle arts!  If you are an employer, you will be able to reach needle artists in your area to fill an open job.  If you are a member looking for a job, you will be able to shop open jobs or post your resume.  ONLY people of the needle arts industry will be participating so you will be able to target your search more directly. 

You will also be able to post your business on THE STITCHERS BIZ!  No matter what area of the needle arts you work in, now you will be able to post WITH pictures and videos!  People will find a way to check YOUR postings Facebook, Pinterest, Tumbler and such!  They will also have a DIRECT way to contact you to hire you to do your work. 

If you are a manufacturer or business, you will be able to put your work out for bid or find someone who can finish a difficult project that you are unable to complete. 

Goodstitches will be working with sponsors that you know and getting good deals for you, the members of Goodstitches. Be it batting, thread, rulers, needles, yarn and embroidery threads...anything that you need to work on your craft, we are doing deals with the manufactures so that we can pass on the GREAT deals to YOU the members of Goodstitches.

We look forward to meeting you in person and getting to know you!

The Goodstitches Team

For any questions, comments, ideas, advertising, or opening a group near you please contact:

Fena D'Ottavio  FenaBiz@gmail.com

Connect With Us! 

Facebook 

Twitter 

Tumblr 

Instagram 

Youtube 

Pinterest

results.description:
Get In2 Nature - Creative Fun 4 Grown-ups. Remember what it was like to be a free-range kid? We spent most of our play time outside. We used our imaginations, we were active, we explored, we made "stuff" in the woods and on the shore. ADULTS GET INTO NATURE MEETUPS are SUMMER CAMP ACTIVITIES 4 ADULTS. Whether we join together for easy trail hiking or biking, art activities or just silly stuff the meetups are sure to be fun and different (emphasize different). But you first have to join and then you have to show up and engage.

Scavenger hunts, archery, kite flying, painting & drawing, sandcastles, driftwood creatures, rock balancing, and much more await you. This is not a serious hiking group nor is it one that focuses on going out to eat and drink (though that might happen on occasion). The focus is on FRESH AIR & CREATIVE FUN OUTDOORS. So sign up! The more the merrier. Get your friends to join and make some new ones too.

Every grown-up is welcome to join but it is required that you to have a clear identifiable photo of yourself so that we can recognize you. And now for the DISCLAIMER: During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. No organizers are responsible for the safety of the participants. By joining the group, you acknowledge this.

results.description: Our mission is to build a community through creativity that is affordable, approachable, and accessible to people of all professions. We host monthly Dinner, Art, + Music nights every Second Sunday from 6:00-9:00 and are always adding more events, including our new Book Club and Fiber Arts group. In the long run, our goal is to create the first community art hotel where everything in the rooms from the food to the furniture to the dishes to the soap is made by members of the community. Patrons who come to stay can buy what they use in their rooms, buy something like it in the gallery, or take a class and learn how to make it. The community art hotel will serve as the center of our creative community while also acting as an incubator to support artists as small businesses. We believe that everyone, whatever their background, makes something and our events encourage participants to connect with and celebrate what they make.  Learn more at: http://mirandashearth.com

We're a group of mobile app developers (iOS and Android), mobile startups, and mobile marketers interested in growing our apps. From organic growth hacking, to paid installs, to deep links and referral systems, we cover all things related to growth. Come hang out with us, listen to some great speakers, and learn from some incredible mobile growth experts. 

Stay up to date with the latest mobile growth tips:

Join us on Facebook | Sign up for the blog | Check out videos from our past events

Mobile Growth Meetups are powered by Branch and Grow.Co.

Branch provides free deep linking technology to mobile app developers and marketers. We're on a mission to help you grow their business through deep linking, and allow users to discover content inside mobile apps. In 14 months Branch grew to a company with 50 employees and raised 18 million in funding. In the last year, Branch has gone from powering deep linking for 6 million users to more than 1 billion users.

Grow.co is a community of growth marketing professionals and brands, comprised of more than 7,000 acquisition and retention-oriented professionals. We serve the community through industry summits, a weekly newsletter, a jobs board, and an online forum.

results.description:
Welcome!  JourneyDance™ is a free-spirited, playful and soulful celebration of life, a barefoot, conscious dance practice that invites us to discover and honor our body’s own intuitive movement.  Our minds become quiet and clear and positive.  As we soften that mental energy, we can release the negativity and judgment that we sometimes carry and our capacity for compassion expands.  JourneyDance™ Conscious Dance Practice is a movement program open to everyone, regardless of physical ability, fitness or prior dance experience. 

Our intention is to come together and become a space to get blissful on the dance floor - to inspire, ignite, and express, to open our hearts and connect with ourselves and one another in joy and wholeness.   

This is a welcoming community of dancing souls!  

We dance to an eclectic mix of music ~~ global, evocative, electronic, funky, familiar and completely unexpected.  JourneyDance is loosely guided and we are invited to move in our own intuitive way.  We begin by warming ourselves and grounding with the earth and establishing a deeper connection within our selves. This creates a foundation that supports our continuing journey to our fullest expression.  Join this radiant dance community and Dance Your Whole Being.  


We have monthly classes at Green Tea Yoga in Salem, Roots to Wings Yoga in Newbury, and Floating Lotus in Gloucester - on Friday and Saturday nights.  Check our calendar for exact dates and times.

Visit www.embodyingsoul.com for more information and to register for classes.  You can also check out the Embodyingsoul & JourneyDance facebook page to keep informed about upcoming JourneyDance events.

When we dance, our purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.~ Wayne Dyer
results.name: JourneyDance & Conscious Movement

results.description:
Our vision is to use an entrepreneurial mindset to advance Asians across all levels of society. We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that is dedicated to the promotion of entrepreneurship and the sustainability of the entrepreneurial culture within the Asian American community in Boston. 

    In America, Asians are vastly underrated and underrepresented in positions of power. We represent 5% of the American population, but only 1-2% of leadership positions in political offices, corporations, healthcare, academia and entrepreneurship.

     Eddie Huang, entrepreneur, writer, and chef, puts it well: “I don't think people understand the model-minority stereotype is negative. You are boxed in. You have to untangle that to find your own path.” With the creativity and passion associated with entrepreneurship, our mission is to help Asians break stereotypes, give Asians a voice and support the Asian community.

     We will reach our vision by connecting, educating, and giving back. Connect: To build connections and create a vibrant community of entrepreneurial-minded people. Educate: To promote learning and help Asians develop an entrepreneurial mindset. Give Back: To provide resources to support our Asian community Programs.

Examples of our programming include: • Leadership Series bringing in successful entrepreneurs to share their story • Monthly Leadership Development Workshops • Summer Entrepreneurship Program for High School students • Directory of Local Asian Entrepreneurs • Monthly Newsletters • Mixers for Entrepreneurs • Book Club focusing on biographies of entrepreneurs


Make sure to join our directory to stay abreast of events and updates!

http://goo.gl/forms/9a34j5a4uV
results.name: Boston Asian Entrepreneurship Foundation

results.description:
Welcome to EF Education First's Meetup page for ed tech buffs in greater Boston.  Most people know EF as the world's leading international education company, and many are surprised to hear that technology, design and innovation are always at the core of our work in travel, language learning, cultural exchange and education.  From launching what has grown into the world's largest online English school with Apple back in the '90s, to our more recent work with LinkedIn on democratizing credentialing for global language learners, our innovation teams experiment with cutting edge and emerging technologies while driving our mission of opening the world through education.  

We're excited to start this group and hopefully meet a bunch of like-minded people in the region who are focused on using technology in the education space in their own meaningful ways.  In the coming months, we plan to host a series of fun Meetups to explore the challenges and opportunities we all face working in this unique space.  Learning from you is just as important to us as sharing the story of our 50-year technology legacy.  

Our first Meetup is coming up in a few weeks.  We're excited to welcome you to our spectacular new North American headquarters in Cambridge to chat, snack, network and imbibe!

Click the link below for more information.
results.name: Developers and Designers in Education - EF Education First

results.description: Welcome to the only beatboxing Meetup in Boston: the Boston Beatboxing Squad! (BBS) Do you beatbox? Do you want to learn? Do you want to improve your skills, or meet other beatboxers to collaborate? Are you a singer or rapper looking for a beatboxer to back your vocals? This group aims to recognize beatboxing (aka vocal percussion) as an art form and musical style. At BBS, we'll be hosting beatboxing technique workshops (learn a new sound to add to your repertoire!), beatbox jam sessions, beatbox open mics and performances, beatbox competitions, and technology workshops (loopers, recording techniques, etc.). Events will take place at various places around Boston with superb echo and reverb! (Think Kenmore station staircase, under bridges, etc.). Brendon Albertson (Green Beatbox) created this group out of a passion to give beatboxing the respect it deserves, just as any other style of music or instrument. A large network of beatboxers exists online, but to this day European countries are far ahead of the U.S. in creating an in-person beatboxing scene. Please support our cause if you're interested! www.greenbeatbox.com
results.name: Boston Beatboxing Squad

results.description: This MEETUP site is primarily for all of the Northern Bristol, Northern Plymouth and nearby Norfolk counties members of the Southeastern Massachusetts Time Exchange and also for non-members who are interested in following it. This MeetUp site is a bulletin board for staying in touch and up to date about Exchange activities in your area. Membership in the Time Exchange is not a requirement for membership in this Meetup group. It is a sister site of South-Coast-Time-Exchangers and Cape-Cod-Time-Exchangers Meetup sites. Time Banking is a means to foster community and mutual aid in this disconnected world. If joining on our EXTERNAL WEBSITE, exchangetime.org, people list their Offers of and Requests for help. When you need help you look to see who is offering that service and get in touch with them. A person providing help gets to "bank" those hours and "spend" them getting someone else to help with whatever s/he needs. It's not direct swap and no goods are exchanged. Just TIME. The idea is to connect and help people through an "alternative" economy. We hold monthly get-togethers, often potlucks, and sometimes also gather at interesting local events. We did a Repair Cafe last summer and plan future Skill Share events. See also hourworld.org.
results.name: SOUTH OF BOSTON TIME EXCHANGERS

results.description:
The goal of this Meetup is to bring the community together to apply data science to improve society.   Some areas that will be addressed include crime, healthcare, transportation, clean energy; income disparity, among others.

The key aspect of this group is that its primary goal is Social Impact.  It is very important that members who join have a strong personal interest and commitment to working on projects that involve social issues.   We will be having training on data science such that if you are a beginner then we will help you improve your skills; to then in turn help you apply this to solve problems.  We will also have events, such as hackathons, where seasoned data analysts and scientists can immediately apply their skills to social issues.

The group will seek to include folks from many different organizations (including government, non-profits, academic researchers, community organizers, corporations, startups) towards working together on initiatives.  Furthermore, there are several existing Meetup groups that are also focused on social impact (though with a different focus, such as Volunteering, Civic Hacking/Coding, Open Government, or the like).  We will look to partner across Meetup groups to bring all of our complementary skills together. 

At our initial meetings, members will help prioritize as to what types of event formats each would like whether hackathons, weekly get-togethers, et al.
results.name: Data Science for Social Good

results.description:
Welcome to the Waldorf Class of 2022 Meetup Group, a website for Waldorf School of Lexington 1st grade families in Ms. Voss' class. This group is designed to continue building our community through social interaction and play, volunteer opportunities that support class/school activities, and many other gatherings that will bring our families together in a supportive, friendly environment. This site will be especially useful during the summer months, when children will be enjoying activities away from school but may want to stay connected to school friends.

The site also includes a Discussion Board. Here you can post family-friendly comments, questions, lunch ideas, articles, etc. Feel free to start your own discussion or add to an existing thread.

To view upcoming gatherings, click on the Calendar button. You can then click on the event name for all the details and to RSVP. If you RSVP positively, you will receive several reminders leading up to the day of the event. An RSVP with regrets will automatically stop future notices regarding this particular event. If you prefer not to receive notices from Meetup informing you of an event, you can change your Meetup settings accordingly. 

The Waldorf Class of 2022 is set up so that anyone in the group can add an event. If you prefer, you can send me a note with the event details and I will gladly add it to the Meetup calendar. 

We hope you enjoy this convenient resource. Please call or send me a note if I can help in any way as you get familiar with the website.
results.name: Waldorf Class of 2022

results.description:
This group is for parents of children born in 2011 and 2012 who wish to meet other working moms and dads trying to balance family life and a career!  This group will allow our little ones to grow up together around similar aged friends.  We'll have affordable activities with our Preschoolers in our neighborhood, like going to story-time at the library, having picnics at the Park, play groups, outings, potlucks, book clubs, and many, many more wonderful activities throughout Boston and the surrounding suburbs. We can also have events for just moms / dads, like movies, dinner, and anything else that looks like fun!

Our group is an open forum, so everybody is welcome to initiate and organize their own events to add to our calendar. Let's get together :)
results.name: Working Parents of Preschoolers

results.description: This group is for people who care about unleashing and engaging the collective intelligence, adaptive capacity and creativity of their teams, organizations, Boards, community groups, etc. Liberating Structures is about action, engagement and collaborative change – practiced through 33 (and growing) easy-to-use, powerful, and continually adaptive group engagement “structures” designed to surface insights, ideate, identify best practices, strategize, or help people see what they can do to make change happen. This group will be focused on exploring Liberating Structures through practice (doing them at the Meetups) as well as sharing experience / knowledge about applying them in work contexts and by exploring opportunities for collaboration and projects. This group is open to anyone; no experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and share.
results.name: Boston Liberating Structures Meetup

results.description: “when you are facing in the right direction, all you have to do is keep on walking…” If you are looking for a group of like minded women that can inspire you to lead a healthy life, in harmony with yourself, others around you, and in nature, then this may be the group for you! This is a group for anyone who has searched high and low for a casual, non-judgmental, fun-filled environment to explore almost anything related to health, wellness, mindfulness, and balance of the mind, body, and spirit. Come join a gathering of women (aged 21+) who may engage in a group yoga or meditation class, share stories, decide to read a particular book of the month, go out dancing, find a crazy outdoor adventure, or simply offer a space to just "be". A place to feel inspired, an alternative to a coffee shop or bar, a community that perpetuates understanding and support. Sometimes we just need to be around other women who "get it"!

We edit photos live in a studio.
Photoshop classes are provided after every shoot.

results.description: Lets build a group of driven professionals who are not looking to succeed but are driven to succeed, there is a big difference. If you are an example of this difference, and are not afraid of hard work, then lets get together brainstorm, =create and build a network!

results.description: Have a drink other than the innumerable lattes you drink at the coffee shop. Let’s get together with some fellow freelancers and have a drink or two. The idea here is to get together to talk, share tips and ideas, and really just hang out over a couple of drinks. There’s a community of us out there; we just aren’t often in the same place. Let’s change that. At this point, I’m just trying to gauge interest in the idea. Once we have a quorum, I’ll figure out the best spot and time to get together.

results.description:
CIC: Community, Innovation, Collaboration. A community of hackers, inventors, artists, and makers. CIC is a community organization founded to support people from all walks of life in their endeavors to create lasting, innovative change. Events produced by CIC cover topics like art, sustainability, musical composition, 3D Printing, writing, DJing, and more. All topics are curated with a focus on forward-thinking designs and solutions, and all events are free and open to the public. The formats of our events vary from after-hours networking to walking exhibits, hands-on activities, creative workshops, and group discussions. As we grow, we will continue to broaden the scope of our event offerings. We are interested in asking tough questions, and in providing the local community with a unique physical space to collaborate on exceptional solutions. This is an exciting time for human civilization and for CIC. Join our group, attend our events, and experience it for yourself.


Please note: Our goal is to create an inclusive and supportive environment, and as such we follow the credo of our sister organization Venture Cafe http://vencaf.org/credo

We believe that innovation is a social process fueled by trust, collaboration, and storytelling, and we thus reserve the right to limit access to any individual at our discretion.
results.name: CIC Cambridge

results.description: WELCOME! This group started for Moola Mantra Month which is in May. Occasionally other chant opportunities will be scheduled. You can join like-mindful people, quiet your mind and raise your energy and the help raise the consciousness of our planet. All religions and no religion welcomed, no chanting experience necessary.
results.name: Moola Mantra Month Chant Challenge, Natick

results.description: Stan Lee and Michael Uslan are leading The Rise of Superheroes and Their Impact on Pop Culture, a course launching on edX. Come join two of the courses developers, Nathan Benjamin and Chris Robichaud, to discuss the course. As you will learn, the course is not only a history of superheroes and comics, but a platform for you to envision and create your own original superhero. This live meetup will also provide a forum to share work and collaborate with others in the Boston/Cambridge comic community.
results.name: edX Superheroes Meetup

results.description: Grab your uke and join us for playing and singing along. We have varying levels of ability and we like a wide range of musical styles. We will meet in Sharon center, accessible on the Providence/Stoughton commuter rail line. There are about a dozen of us who have been meeting weekly since January 2015, and we'd like to meet more ukulele players in the area.

results.description: Ideas are at the center of political change. We discuss good books and essays dealing with Progressive political history, themes, and thought at my place. Open-mindedness and sociability emphasized; pretension and sectarianism frowned upon.
results.name: The Cambridge Progressive Book Salon

results.description: Interested in Jazz? Want to hear Live Jazz or play it? In this MeetUp Group, we bring Jazz-to-the-People. Whether you're a Jazz Newbie, a die-hard Enthusiast or a Jazz Musician, this MeetUp group brings together those who love America's first - and greatest - original art-form. - Are you a Jazz Novice? Here's a chance to do so by listening to it and talking about it with both enthusiasts and the musicians who create it. - Do you love to play Jazz? Unlike other sessions and jams, here's a chance to do so, and to engage with those who come to listen in-between sets. - Are you a Jazz Enthusiast? Want to share your knowledge ("who played cornet on Jacque St. Clair's recording of 'Vital Stats'?") with musicians - or even with newbies who've yet to explore the world of Jazz that you love? If any of these describe you, then this MeetUp is for you. Forged from Delta Blues, infused with African and Latin rhythms, and using American energy and ingenuity to push the limits of harmonic and melodic boundaries, Jazz can bring together peoples of a wide variety of backgrounds, regardless of class, ethnicity or education. Come join us as we celebrate, play and listen to Live Jazz!
results.name: Cambridge Jazz Meetup for Civilians and Musicians alike

results.description: It's time to get griffy! We had our first ever Boston Brussels Griffon Meetup on June 7th and it was a success ;)  Affenpinschers welcome as well as mixed breeds in the Brussels and Affenpinscher family. Ticket sales will go towards the cost for renting out the space for the meetup. Please bring $5 per pup to cover the rental fee for the space.

Why do we have to travel to Boston, Cambridge, or Manchester to socialize, connect with other technology professionals to build our professional networks? We should be meeting up and and sharing knowledge right here. We should organize a monthly meetup in a semi-private room where there is food and drink, a projector, 15-20 minutes of talks, and then socialize.

*Games will be started up again in the Spring of 2016*



Hello Soccer Players,

Pick-up soccer games will be set up regularly in Boston and Quincy, probably 1-2 game(s) per week. All levels are welcome. All genders welcome.


Simple rules to follow:

1. Be friendly. Leave your negativity at home. We are here to have fun, not deal with drama. Any serious insults or physical altercations with other member(s) will result in banning from this group.

2. If you gotta spit, don't do it inside the play zone. Do it on the outside of the cones.

3. No arguing over plays.


Games scheduled in the Spring, Summer, and Fall.

Many of us have friends who look at us a little strange when we start to ramble about the latest slasher, zombie, or supernatural movie that we can't get off our minds. So if you're looking to meet like-minded people in the city who enjoy offbeat, darker entertainment....then this if your group. We screen new movies, watch older cult classics, attend conventions, and discuss and debate all things horror. We welcome different ideas and interests within the genre and sometimes loosely related to the genre (science fiction, fantasy, etc). We look forward to going on some outings with fellow horror fans!

results.description: This is a group for anyone interesting flying gliders and learning about the sport of soaring in New England. All skill levels are welcome. Instruction is available if you are interested in learning how to fly, or just sit back and enjoy a thrilling demonstration flight surrounded by breathtaking scenery. I started this group to promote the sport of soaring in New England. I am a commercial pilot, and have been flying gliders and powered aircraft for over 20 years. All flying will be with soaring clubs around New England. Let's go fly gliders together.

results.description:
Grow your business by making the customer the center of your business. Join Boston's leading forum of marketing, sales and service executives interested in learning and discussing new ways to optimize the customer experiences at all touch points and increase the impact of engagement throughout the customer lifecycle.

Who Should Attend

This forum is ideal for business-to-business marketers, sales and service professionals interested in learning and sharing best practices and proven strategies for generating strong long-term customer, brand and channel engagement and advocacy through tailored and targeted customer experience structures and processes. Some of the topics we plan on exploring include:

• Market Research: Designing effective strategies for uncovering customer intelligence and voice of the customer insights

• ROI: Building the financial business case for an enhanced CX strategy

• Social Media: Using social media to mobilise customer engagement

• Digital Marketing: Understanding the digital path to purchase and the implications for sales and marketing

• Mobile: Refining mobile customer experiences

• Content Marketing: Developing a content strategy that drives engagement

• Data Analytics: understanding the power of data to identify customer engagement opportunities

Meeting Format

Our monthly meetings are designed to offer a good mix of networking and learning opportunities. Our meetings will generally follow the format outlined below:

• Networking: bring your business cards and develop new connections with your peers across verticals

• Learning session + Q&A: Learn and share about the topic in focus for the month

• Business Spotlight: Each month, we'll ask a member to share a specific customer engagement challenge they are facing and ask the cross-functional group to brainstorm solutions.

Sponsored By

EngageQuest Research is a custom research-based consultancy helping B2B organizations improve digital media effectiveness and strategy by better understanding the markets and customers they serve. Visit us at www.engagequest.com to learn how we can help you.
results.name: Boston B2B Customer Engagement Group

results.description: The Boston ScFi meetup will meet once a month at the Watertown Public Library from 7-830 or 9. The first meeting will be on June 24. Meetings will center on discussions of 2-4 ScFi--and occasionally fantasy--short stories. Each meetup we will discourse on at least one classic story--works of Phillip K. Dick, Arthur C. Clark, etc--and at least one modern story from a ScFi magazine, usually post 2005. Participants will be expected--though technically not required--to read no less than one of the selected readings. The imperative of the group is to promote and invigorate the ScFi community in Boston.

results.description:
EMBA members meet once a week as a group for an hour and a half.  

Our Andover chapter meets weekly each Thursday morning, from 7:00 am-8:30 am.  

Meetings are held on the first floor of the LANAM club at 260 North Main Street in Andover.

The purpose of the meetings isn’t social (though they are social, and can be comical at times too!)
EMBA’s membership is diverse and covers a variety of different businesses. Our meetings are designed to provide the most effective means of updating EMBA members of new opportunities, new information and new developments which lead to new business for our members. 

We hold OPEN HOUSE Meetups 3 times per year. 
We invite you to join us at one of these special meetings to meet our members, learn more about the Eastern Massachusetts Business Association, and hear an outstanding guest speaker.
Prospective members (visitors) may also come with a group member to a "regular" weekly meeting. Contact us for more information if you'd like to attend a "regular" meeting as a guest.

Compared to some of the other B2B/B2C Networking Groups, we're HALF the cost, and members get TWICE the business!
results.name: Eastern Massachusetts Business Association (EMBA)

results.description: We are a real estate investment and management company that purchase and resale performing and non-performing real estate notes. Boston Mortgage Notes Meetup will meet on a weekly basis to learn how to analyze 2nd mortgage notes. We encourage real estate investors and anyone in the Boston area that is interested in investing in notes to join our meetup group. Many of our meetups will consist of webinars, conference calls, expos, lunch and learns, seminars, and training courses. I started this meetup group to become more active in the Boston area while getting more people involved in the note investing business. 6 months down the road I hope members of this meetup group will know how to buy and resale notes in addition to processing a note. results.description: Welcome to Sudbury, MA Public Library's Krosslink program. Krosslink.org is a volunteer-driven community program created to help develop, nurture, and foster entrepreneurship by connecting aspiring entrepreneurs to local business leaders, mentors and civic leaders who can help them achieve their goals. The program creates a unique link with local libraries that empowers them to evolve their mission into “Entrepreneur Greenhouses”. The result is a vibrant eco-system where individuals looking to build a business can find resources and activities to kick start their plans such as networking events with other business leaders, a collaborative workspace filled with keynote speakers, bar-stool pitch sessions, facilitated meet-up sessions and mentoring by SCORE business experts. For more details on how you can leverage this ecosystem to develop your business, please visit us at www.krosslink.org

results.description:
This is a meetup group for anyone who is interested in learning Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark.

Apache Cassandra is an open source database - Highly Scalable, High Performance, High Availability - Can run on more than 1000 nodes in a single cluster.

Apache Spark is a fast engine for large-scale data processing - 100 times faster than Hadoop. Write applications quickly in Java, Scala or Python. Spark can perform complex analytics on data stored in Cassandra.

Join this group and let's learn Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark.


*** If you have experience with Apache Cassandra and/or Apache Spark, please join our group and help us learn, these new exciting technologies ***
results.name: Learn Cassandra & Spark (Waltham MA)

results.description:
Dance into Joy Bedford is a bi-weekly hour-long facilitated "expressive" dance practice to an inspiring curated playlist of music. We meet on the first and third Tuesdays of the month. You can let go of mental chatter, refresh your mind, and rejuvenate your body, inspire your heart and soul. Dancing provides balance from what ever busy-ness or non-activity you’ve been engaged in. Dancing your heart out allows you to process and integrate the challenges you've needed to face. In this sage and expressive practice you can expand your sense of connection to yourself,  to others and the "divine". 

Each class comes with a new playlist of music, new suggestions for movement, and of course, you will be in a new place each time you come. Sometimes you’ll arrive fatigued, looking to renew. Other times you’ll come with lots of energy. Each class is designed to bring you into the most powerful, loving and inspired connection to yourself. As a ritual practice over time, your self expression becomes freer, more confident, more varied. Your sense of who you are and what you can accomplish expands. You may enter into a state of BLISS. There is Live music several times a year and occasional special events.
results.name: Bedford Get Comfortable Moving - Dance into your Joy Meetup

results.description: HordoN HEALTH is the home of Musculosystematics, specializing in movement patterns that result in efficient and healthy movements for a healthy and productive lifestyle.
results.name: HordoN HEALTH

topics.name: Taiji - Tai Chi - Qigong an Excercise in Peace

results.description: Calling all Earth Citizens! (Yes, that's YOU!!) This meetup combines the best of holistic fitness and wellness practice with community activism and service. Make the connection between how you take care of yourself and how you take responsibility for the world around you. We'll have 2 types of Meetups: 1) health and fitness get-togethers at local parks or yoga studios where we practice simple exercise, breathing and meditation techniques. 2) volunteering events and projects like park cleanups, visiting senior centers, assisting charity drives and community events, and more... The Earth Citizen Movement is founded on the belief that self-development as a person- being healthy, happy and peaceful- is critical to the long-term impact you can make for the larger community. Our aim is to empower people with helpful self-care techniques while at the same time experiencing the difference self-care makes when helping others.
results.name: Boston Earth Citizens: Holistic Fitness & Service

results.description:
This Meetup group facilitates the creation of study groups among students in the One Year MBA program at Babson.

Wanna prepare for an exam, read for class, work on an assignment, or just revise certain topics?  Create a study group to do this together with other people in your class! Create a post (event) and others can join you. 

Studying in groups is proven to be an effective way to study! Collaborative study helps to learn collectively from each other and is a whole lot more fun than studying alone. Plus, it will keep you from procrastinating!
results.name: Babson Study Groups (One Year MBA)

results.description:
" GAMBETA "

Spanish Definiton:

"En el fútbol, regate, movimiento del jugador para evitar que le arrebate el balón el contrario."

English Translation-In soccer: The swerve, the movement of the player intending to prevent the loss of the ball to a grab from an opposite player.

We play in Brookline and on occasion in Cambridge as well.  

We are a friendly and very international group of futbol lovers.

All new members require approval and  a clear face image as profile.

Our roster is kept small (Ideally under 40) and made up only of current, active players who want to recreate the childhood joy of playing the world's most beautiful sport. 

We currently have representatives from 28 different countries:

Chile, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, El Salvador, Cape Verde, Uganda, Ghana, India, Saudi Arabia, Turkey, Kuwait, Dubai, Nepal, Thailand, South Korea, Germany, Canada, USA, UK, Italy, France, Ireland, Israel, Lebanon, and the Netherlands. 

WE KEEP OUR GROUP SMALL-BUT SELECTIVE, we all have different styles but are here for the same reason, so lets play well, play hard, play respectfully.  

I am Chileno and have been playing futbol for 27 years--I simply love the game.  We are looking for experienced and confident players to join us. 

Our Meet Up is a weekly 6 v 6  game on high quality turf, with lacrosse goals, sometimes half sized soccer goal. We play straight for two hours.  

Rules:

Universal rules with exceptions: no through ins- we pass the ball in, with your feet.

We play hard, to win- but safe. No sliding for split balls, its OK to slide for scoring and saving balls from rolling out. JUST BE SAFE and aware of those around you.

IMPORTANT:

"WANNABE" COACHES/EXPERTS, TRASH TALKERS, OR AGRESSIVE PLAYERS WILL BE REMOVED AND NOT BE REINVITED--THEY WILL INSTEAD BE ASKED TO STAY HOME TO WATCH "GolTV. "

Cleats are allowed, shin guards are your option.

Like when we were kids, here you play at your OWN risk.

Exact location and time will be shown to members only, two guest maximum per member.

We look forward to playing together.

Lastly: Maradona was and will forever be the best soccer player! Ronaldo Silva the only close second place. 

-Daniel Eduardo

GAM BETA: started may, 2015.
results.name: "GAMBETA"

results.description:

We are a group of 20- & 30-somethings who love meeting new people and enjoying life. From restaurants, bar nights, and movies, to ice skating, bowling, laser tag, and hiking, to overnight camping trips and snow sports, we love all kinds of fun! Come join the Social Scene!

Once you get to know us, please consider chipping in online or at an event to cover our meetup group fee! It costs $90 every six months to keep the group running. We hope to see you soon!

results.description:
The idea for girl time | tea time came about when a group of friends were gathered around a table sipping tea and eating a few tasty treats. The conversation flowed easily.  We shared our experiences about home design frustrations and joys. At the end of our gathering, a few commented that this felt like a design therapy session and we should do it again. 

girl time | tea time was founded. How wonderful to welcome new people, to share experiences, and create a growing circle of new and old friends. There is NO prerequisite of a design background needed to participate. All that is required is an interest in home decor. 

We gather monthly at my studio to share our design triumphs and challenges. We have teamed up with local vendors Jolie Tea Company to provide tea +  PURE Pastry for our sweet treats. 

Looking to grow this circle of girl time | tea timers. We enjoy spending some time talking about things we love and are interested in while meeting new people.

A $5 donation is requested at the door.
results.name: girl time | tea time in Wenham

results.description:
We're people who got tired of networking events. Instead of grabbing a slice of pizza and making awkward conversation, we wanted to do something we intuitively enjoy and get to know strangers on a personal level. Develop friendships instead of what-can-you-do-for-me attitudes. Come rock climbing, enjoy a beer for your reward, and meet other active people in the tech community.

Can't wait to see you up on the wall!

This group will focus on bringing folks together who share this drive to transform Downtown Lynn. You should join this group if you love Lynn, love local live entertainment, and like to enjoy performing arts in a social, networking context. results.description:
For many years I have worked in physical therapy and the fitness industry. I have a B.S in exercise physiology and am working on a graduate degree in nutrition. The path through which I grew to care for, and enjoy my body has been long and comprehensive. Though the insults to our physical form may vary in story, the ability to move beyond our preconceived notions of what our bodies "must be" remains universal. It is my sincerest hope to share not only my personal journey to physical and emotional stability, but to also give access to the massive body of scientific knowledge I have accumulated through the years of my search for "me". I am sure there  is a wealth of knowledge to be gained from sharing our mutual experiences, and the progression of that experience is the purpose of this meetup. 

As organizer, I would like this group to be not only talkative, but also active. As it develops, I would like us to host exercise-based meet ups and also nutrition focused discussions. If it can help and we have the skills, we can do it in this group! 

Members should be open to discussing our shared experiences regarding what struggles we have had in learning healthy ways to interact with our physical selves, and also be willing to share the creative solutions they have developed to form that relationship. I would like us to share not only our emotional insights, but our healthy habits as well. From group boot camp sessions to gluten-free  educational potlucks - or summer meditation - this meet up group is intended for women to help move one another forward.
results.name: Whole Body Helpings

results.description:
To foster sharing of knowledge, experience, and networking, this is a community for researchers and professionals involved and/or interested in quantitative systems approach to drug development (discovery, preclinical, clinical, post-market).

Quantitative systems pharmacology is an interdisciplinary and an emerging field. It starts with the qualitative understanding of the dynamical inter-relation between components of a biological system or sub-systems under consideration and initial data generation. Through iterative process of- systems model based analysis of the data, evolving understanding of the underlying system generating the data, further data generation, and so on- we can get a much cleaner and quantitative understanding of the system to inform drug development starting from discovery stage. 

In this community, we welcome researchers and non-researchers in industry, academia, and training from diverse disciplines/departments (including but not limited to DMPK, ADME, PKPD, modeling and simulation, systems biology, pharmacology, pharmacometrics, QSP, engineering, mathematics and statistics, bioinformatics, etc).
results.name: Boston Quantitative Systems Pharmacology Meetup

results.description:
This group is for people who are interested in exploring labyrinth walking as a meditative, spiritual or personal growth practice.

Labyrinths are one of the oldest tools for contemplative and transformative self reflection.

Labyrinths are different from mazes. A labyrinth offers only one path into the center, and the same path back out. Although there are turns to negotiate, there are no blind alleys, dead ends, or tricks - as in a maze. In fact, quite the opposite - the ancient design of a labyrinth was created for the powerful purpose of allowing you to completely trust the path you are on, to let your mind simply rest, that your spirit might find its way to your inner center along the path.

The creation of labyrinths in all kinds of media (stones, earth, portable painted canvases), has had a great resurgence in recent years. There are many labyrinths in this area. I would love for this group site to become a channel for folks to plan walks, connect and explore labyrinths all around. 

I also encourage this space to be a community center of information for sharing and learning about labyrinths and the practice of labyrinth walking together. 

If this is of interest to you, please join us. I look forward to walking with you!

To begin, I want to invite you to a regular monthly Full Moon Labyrinth Walk that I host at the Somerville Growing Center (just outside of Union Square in Somerville). I offer this outdoor labyrinth walk gathering each month on the Sunday nearest the full moon - May through October. Please look for more details listed on our meetup site. Welcome, and feel free to message if you have questions and/or ideas!

[a quote from The Way of the Labyrinth by Helen Curry: “People come to labyrinths for a multitude of reasons, but most find that walking a labyrinth can be a transformative experience. As people tread through the turns and counterturns, the world begins to drop away. Walking, breathing, being - things that we never think about in the day-to-day whirl of life - become conscious and deliberate. The spiritual and physical merge into a walking meditation. Our pace becomes a background rhythm against which we are able to clear our minds.”]
results.name: Labyrinth Walking

results.description:
Milford Walking (or Jogging) Group

Welcome! We are about Fitness and  Friendship come Walk or Jog with Us

Location: 

Fino Field 

80 Granite St. Milford, MA

(We will be gathering around the parking lot entrance near the “Fino Field” sign - on the trail)

June 8th - Oct. 8th.

Groups are: 6-7pm

We Meet Every:

 Monday, Wednesday, & Friday

You can also join the Group here: 

www.Meetup.com/Milford-Walking-or-Jogging-Group/


Description:

   Groups will start with a short warm up walk, followed by a session of stretches, and then we will start our walk or jog.  (Whichever you chose is right for you.)

   You don't need to be super fit to join in our walks or jogs. Go at your own pace and do what feels comfortable for you. 

  For those who are able, there will also be a more advanced pack with faster pace, these will usually be the Joggers.

   Also, Please bring $5. and I will Collect it & Attach it to your Registration Form which I will give you to fill out when you Arrive.I ask everyone to please pitch in $5. per person Each Month. This is a Non-Profit Group. All proceeds are used to cover operating costs, like the meetup website we pay to have the group posted on, outside advertising, group supplies, etc. 

   So come, have fun, talk, laugh, walk (or jog) or both lol and I look forward to meeting you and seeing you at The Milford Walking (or Jogging) Group!

Thanks,

  Joiee

About Me:

   My name is Joiee, and I'm starting this group because I've realized I have the most motivation to go walking and jogging when I've got friends and people to do it with. So I've created this group in order to bring people together form friendships and help one another stay motivated. So come walk or jog, talk, laugh and just have fun!


If you have any other questions feel free to contact me at this Email: MilfordWalkingJoggingGroup@gmail.com


   (No Dogs, Kids, Babies, Strollers, Rollerblades, Bikes etc.)

- combinatorics
- number theory
- graph theory
- geometry
- string analysis
- data structures
- network security
- software explotation

We'll focus on moderate level challenges at first. Everyone will have time to attempt the challenge, and then we'll discuss our thoughts, approaches, and solutions as a group. We'll compare execution speed and memory usage, but conceptual elegance will also be heavily weighted. results.description:
Food cravings are killers. They take hold like parasites in our brains, and make us do things—even while we are doing them—that we don’t want to be doing, that make us feel out of control, and which injure us. Sound familiar?

     This Meetup is for people who know what I am talking about. Who may have gained weight as a result of having these cravings. Who may have lost opportunities in their lives—romantic, social, business—because of weight gain and being overweight. These cravings—and all the problems associated with them—can be eliminated. Ask me. I went through what I’m describing many years ago, gaining weight, eating a pound of chocolate a day, and feeling gross and disgusting. I was overweight as a kid, and—long story short—developed an alcohol problem as a young adult. Managed to sober up at age 33, but my addiction switched to food, and eventually—another long story made short—discovered a solution. A solution that I’ve improved on, and use to this day.

     And I decided to share it with the world. You don’t have to live with the pain of being overweight. Of dealing with “weight creep”, as it inches upward. Of the stress of feeling your clothing getting tighter and tighter. Of constantly berating, belittling and beating yourself up for being unable to deal with this. Of knowing things won’t get better the way you are going now. There is a solution for you. That’s what this Meetup is for. To give you the first steps toward regaining control over your eating, and your life. To help you not only lose weight, but more importantly, keep it off.

     And not only will the Meetup be free, but for attending you will get a report entitled “What the Diet Experts and Gurus Don’t Know”. Plus you will get actionable steps as to what to do next.

     This is a whole foods, plant based approach--but don't worry!  There is no political agenda, this is only an approach to health and weight loss and management.  No one is going to insist you stop eating meat, unless you choose.  There are SO many benefits of doing so, that you may decide for yourself that it is a direction you want to go.  Even if you don't know how to cook, give it a try--do you have anything to lose, except some weight?
results.name: Curb Those Cravings!  Healthy Eating = Healthy Weight Loss!

When we decided to create The Sancturay of Acton, it was with intention to do good for the community and bring together a collective of healthy, happy, conscious people who desire to live with meaning and purpose. 

Healing is about wholeness in mind, emotions, body & soul. Here we aim to empower people to live authentically, develop skills of personal mastery through one on one wellness sessions and transformational workshops. Our classes are provided by experts in the areas of holistic healing, energy medicine, metaphysics, spirituality, yoga, mindfulness and more. 

As a community, we gather with hopes to create a place for budding relationships with light hearted, like minds. People celebrating life events together with pot-lucks, documentary nights, herb prep classes, book clubs or other fun social activities that cultivate JOY for us to bring out into the world. 

Come join us in co-creating this vision, meet new friends, become better acquainted with others.

Calling all Asians out there who are a tad older than 30 but still young at heart and interested in meeting new people. 

Bored with another night in front of TV / Computer?  Not sure which of your friends have time?  Friends are not as close by as you like?     Looking to meet new people who may have similar or not so similar backgrounds?

Well, I have a Meetup for you!!! 

We are a  couple of American Born Chinese (ABCs) in our late 30s/early 40s who are looking to  meet up with some new people to share in conversations, food and laughter.  While there are so many great meetups out there I could not find one that was really geared towards Asians in our age group in and around Boston so what to do but to create one -  create it and they will come (hopefully). 

The plan is to have both Adult only events for both singles and not so singles. and  family events that would include kids since you're never too young to meet new people who may not otherwise cross your path.

Whether you are new to town or lived here all your life, come out and meet up with us and find out if we are your stereotypical Asians or maybe you are?  We look forward to meeting you all and having some fun meetups. If any one else like to join this group as an organizer, please feel free to reach out to me. Thanks!!!

results.description:
Come and play with us!

Sex Positive New England is a real and growing community of open-minded, alive, and awake people. This community provides a chance to explore, learn, and grow in a safe, welcoming, and consensual environment. We require applicants to fill out an application, which is reviewed by real live people, so please answer the questions thoroughly and thoughtfully. We actually read your answers carefully and may decline applications based on inadequate answers. Your answers will be visible only to members of the group. Couples must complete separate profiles and applications.; they may reference each other if they wish. Because we are a real community; we request a recognizable picture of you on your profile.

Before you apply, please read this entire page and the recommended documents. Then come back and complete your application.

We want active, aware members who attend events, plan or host events, and bring as much to us as we bring to them. We like to play together because we trust each other.

We believe that sexual energy can be a powerful tool for transformation, healing, solidifying relationships, and building community, and we develop that energy in fun events that are generally free or carry a small cost to cover expenses.

Education, workshops, parties, classes, and outings

Touch: As we understand the importance of touch in our lives, we create events that focus on touch, such as massage events and cuddles. Sensation: The senses are the gateway to the brain, so we plan sensual feasts, naked yoga, dance parties, nature-oriented outings, concerts, and theater. Sexuality: Members plan events centered around understanding and exploring all aspects of human sexuality, relationship styles, kink, gender and orientation. SPNE welcomes heteros, gays, trans, bi's, monos, polys, those questioning, and lovers of every age.

What is Sex Positivity?

Sex positivity is a social movement and philosophy which regards all consensual expressions of sexuality as healthy, encourages sexual pleasure and experimentation, places an emphasis on informed consent and advocates sex education and risk-aware sex. Sex-positivity makes no moral distinctions among types of sexual expression, orientation or identification, regarding these choices as matters of personal preference.

What does our group do?

We are a community of like-minded people, and a non-profit education and advocacy group. Using Meetup as a platform we sponsor events that promote the forming of a strong and well informed community of sex-positive people who support each other in their endeavors to lead richer, fuller, sexier, lives. Our mission is to improve the world by embracing the tenets of the Sex-Positive Movement. Most of our events fall into either the social, or workshop categories; others include festivals, fundraisers and field trips. We place a strong emphasis on community building.

What is an Orientation?

After you have joined the group you can attend any level 1 event that interests you. In order to become fully active in the group we require you to attend an Orientation. This full-evening of activity introduces our ideas and mission, explains how our group and events work, and includes some fun interactive games. These occur on the first Sunday of every month, and in the middle of the month. After orientation, if you are invited into the group, you may attend other events.

About Events

SexPositive events are coded Level 1 through Level 3

Level One:  Friendly, flirtatious, and playful, light touch such as hand to hand, or hand to face, "friendly style" rather than "sensual" or "sexual". Activities might include workshops, classes, meet and greets, book clubs, eating, or dancing.

Level Two: Sensual, increasingly flirtatious, but not sexual. Activities might include workshops or classes with nudity or live demonstrations, light touching, sexy dancing, massage, or kissing. Topless disrobing may occur at some events. 

Level Three: More overtly sexual. Activities might include intimate touch, playful exploration between individuals, couples, or groups. No genital play. May include full nudity. 

How Do I participate at Events?

Respect Boundaries: At events you are expected be respectful of the boundaries of others and of the event, to take care of yourself, and honor your boundaries and agreements. Beyond that, anything else is up to you. 

You are always at choice: You will never be expected to do anything you don't want to, or to interact with anyone you don’t wish to. But we do expect you to contribute to the vibe through positive social interaction.

Sex-positivity is about authentic, respectful, open communication, and being honest about your desires.

We look forward to seeing you at an event soon!
results.name: Sex Positive New England

results.description:
This is a radical book club for Women of Color (WoC), and we will be reading books written by or starring WoC and LGBTQIA People of Color (PoC). Unapologetically, we won't be reading any books written or starring dead old white guys. The goal is to get a taste of every genre, and to find interesting page-turners.

We know that reading a book is a big commitment, and want to give you a chance to get to know the group before putting time aside in your busy lives. We host many fun social events and meet & greets. Please make sure to update your RSVP if your plans change! :)

In terms of the books, we're talking REAL diversity here. Meaning in genre (hidden Sci-fi gems, radical thrillers, escapist but hilariously fun trash-fiction) geographic location (non-Western authors who speak a language other than English) and gender (You said what? The main character is a spaceship in a universe without gender? That's right!!).

All are welcome, but this is specifically a safe place for PoC (of any gender identity and orientation), so if you're not a PoC or a Queer PoC, we expect you to be a good ally.

**If anything said during our meetings ever makes you feel uncomfortable, hella oppressed, or silenced, please contact any of the organizers directly. We make every effort to make this a safe space, and will address any issues to the best of our ability.

Once I see where everyone is from who joins I will try to make meetups in a central location or if it's further away give more notice.

Information About Member Dues:

Some Meetup locations are free, but based on participant feedback charging a small amount per event is favorable to a yearly fee or a larger fee when the event space is not free. I think I've come up with a good way to handle this.


Your first Meetup attended is free regardless of the location and each subsequent event you attend will cost $5. I would prefer you pay the night of the event with cash or check. When you pay with a card on the Meetup site your $5 turns into $4.12 for the group. If you would prefer to pay with a card we can setup something with PayPal (they only charge fees for large amounts).


All money collected will go towards the cost to use Meetup.com, securing future event space and the occasional snack for a meeting. I will start a shareable spreadsheet to keep track of dues and expenses so everyone is aware where their money is going.

Metaverse: a collective virtual shared space. The sum of all virtual worlds, augmented reality, & the internet.  Where we'll tell stories and create moving experiences.

Creators! Do you work in, or are looking to enter a new medium like YouTube or Virtual Reality? Are you a filmmaker seeking a writer, actors, or crew? A Youtuber who needs a musician to collaborate with? Are you a gamer seeking advice on making Let's Plays for YouTube? A Game Developer hiring artists? Looking for a marketing strategist who can help you with SEO, cross-promotion, AdSense? Are you a beauty/fitness expert or company/brand hoping to team up with people with gear, skills and experience to produce online videos? 

You've come to the right place. Metaversal is the brain child of filmmaker/YouTuber/VR dreamer Michelle "MichelleKenobi" Osorio. The Boston branch is the first (flagship) of this upstart national group, started out of a need for new media creatives to have a fun place to meet and find other pioneering content creators to collaborate with. 

Let's leverage our talented community and come together to support each other and work on each other's videos, films, songs, games, apps and experiences. 

Filmmakers:  In this new age, it's not just about bringing writers, actors and filmmakers together. Online video platforms (such as YouTube) are a real, profitable and legitimate industry for content creators. As a YouTuber, virtual reality artist, AND filmmaker myself, I believe these types of creatives should work together and combine talents! 

VR/AR:  Virtual (or Augmented) Reality. This is an exciting new medium that needs more immersive content. Be sure to check out the Boston VR Meetup group too!

YouTubers:  Collaboration is THE singular most important thing you can do to gain subscribers and give your videos exposure, so come out, meetup and play!  

- Michelle Osorio, YouTuber behind Kill9TV & Organizer
- Krystal Tucker, Co-Organizer

results.description:
This is a group to share, discuss, and get feedback on mathematically-oriented independent research ideas that members wish to pursue. The focus is on problems with a technical component. They can be in any field and need not emphasize pure mathematics. However, the research must involve reproducible mathematical calculations or computational procedures. The research should be original -- whether or not it turns out to be novel.

Many of us have interesting research ideas outside our formal area of expertise that we'd like to explore or actually are exploring.  Academic research has grown highly compartmentalized.  Determining an appropriate publication venue, tracking down relevant prior work, and casting language into field-specific terminology can easily become a full time job.  Even determining whether the work has been done before can be quite a challenging task.  We're often faced with a choice:  spend our free time solving interesting problems or spend it dealing with these tasks.  

The goal of this group is both to provide a forum for sharing such ideas and to aid members in exploring possible venues for publication where applicable.  

Here is a quick test to see if you would enjoy this group:

   1.  Do you tend to come up with interesting ideas, possibly in widely varying fields, with a mathish bent?  If the answer is no, then your meetup search criteria may need some work.

   2.  Do you actually have the time and inclination to solve those problems?  If the answer is no, then what you're looking for is a grad student.

   3.  Would you say you do enough quick checking to avoid spending "a month in the lab" to "save an hour in the library", as the old adage goes?  If not, then you may wish to try a magical incantation that goes "google".

   4.  Are you ok with (unknowingly) doing something that already has been done?  If the answer is no, then you need to spend the next 16 years of your life in academia developing cutting edge expertise in one field.

   5.  Would you say you have some sort of academic background in a technical discipline (physics, math, engineering, CS, etc), are familiar with the nature of scientific research, and follow such methods in your own research?  I.e., is your approach methodical, reproducible, and technical?  If not, then your ideas are brilliant and the establishment is persecuting you and you are way way way too smart for this group.  We'd never understand your perpetual motion idea and are too closed minded to hear you endlessly explain your latest conspiracy theory.  You're looking for the group next door.
   
   6.  Are you open to feedback, including criticism, and including being proven completely wrong?  While feedback in our group will be constructive, are you ready to hear -- "Hey, isn't that just the Jablowski equation?" or "Um, that missing minus sign invalidates your entire argument."?  If not, the you're probably looking for a mutual affirmation group.  If you need someone to simply tell you you're a genius, I can recommend this great guy on the corner in Harvard Square.  For just $10 he'll tell you that you're the smartest person on the planet and justify it by misquoting various famous people.  He services most of the Harvard faculty, from what I hear.
 
   7.  Are you open to writing up and presenting your idea?  If not, then you probably are onto something really really really big.  You should hide the encrypted hard drive in a safe that you sink in the ocean.  Don't forget to have (old) Spock cut out a piece of your brain and seal it in an alternate universe to protect you from yourself as well.  Otherwise, the government will steal and misuse it, other scientists will plagiarize it, and/or Apple will patent it and sue you.   
 
The problems our members tackle need not be profound or earth shattering.  The subjects can vary all over the place.  If you want a flavor of what I've played with recently, you can look at my idea blog "www.aplaceofsand.com" (it has a mix of other stuff too -- but the "Fairness in sentencing", "Inflation", and "Voting" articles are representative).  

For obvious reasons, I'm going to be selective in admission to this group.  This isn't (just) because I'm pretentious.  I want to ensure that members will share reasonable ideas and offer reasonable feedback.  If you read through this huge blurb, you've passed motivation test #1.  

Motivation test #2 involves sending me some work you did.  It can be an academic publication if you have one, or an unpublished piece.  For this purpose, it need not be a creative work (a pedagogical one will suffice).  However, it should have a technical aspect to it.  Also, please provide a brief description of your background and interests.  

I also reserve the right (and will exercise it) to revoke membership for anyone who meaningfully misrepresents themselves or their work.  Really, don't bother.  It will be blatantly obvious after 5 minutes of casual conversation.  You'll be unhappy and I'll be unhappy, and this group is about fun and happiness.
results.name: Boston Area Research Projects Group

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind

• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities
• Develop new resources and capabilities
• Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.
Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.
Discover the passion and power that resides within you
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.
You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.
Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.
Alternate Tuesdays at 7:30 PM at Unity of Somerville, located at 6 William Street at the corner of College Avenue

Call (913) 927-4281 to learn more

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.
Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913) 927-4281 for more information
results.name: Awaken the Healing Power Within Your Body and Mind

results.description:
“What is Sonic Osmosis?”

Ask me tomorrow and you may get a different answer.  Today, Sonic Osmosis is a playground for Improvised Music.  If you ever met Improvised Music, you know she has a free spirit.  She doesn’t like being told what to play, when to play, or whom to play with.  Sadly, many venues don’t have the patience to indulge Improvised Music and her whimsical ways.  “Sell more drinks!” they scream at her.  Thank [higher power] for Out of the Blue Too Gallery!

Once a month (or so), we book a handful of groups and solo performers who have made the foolhardy choice to court this lovely, impetuous muse.  Each group/artist plays at least one 10-20 minute set, at some point during the night -- no set times, because of course, Improvised Music would scoff at the idea.

Mixed in between these sets, we shake it up!  Hopefully you aced AP Statistics, because any permutation is possible in these untethered moments.  Members of different groups might form an impromptu ensemble; two or more groups might fuse into a super-group in a brilliant stellar collision…

And maybe…bold audience members, who came with noise-makers in tow, step into the playground and add their verse to our collective ode.  Don’t worry -- no one will pressure you to participate, for the muse surely would not approve.

Hopefully, by the end of the night we have expanded our vocabulary, sensitivity, and imagination, had some fun and satisfied our insatiable muse!

If you’ve still got questions about what this is all about, my name is Marc, leave me a message!  I may or may not have answers, for I cannot claim to fully understand this ethereal temptress…
results.name: Sonic Osmosis - Cambridge

results.description:
Catholics Against Militarism is a lay Catholic movement that aims to expel militarism from the American Catholic Church by 1) registering dissent at the parish level, 2) raising awareness of the dangers of militarism through dialogue with fellow believers, and 3) spurring deeper, more honest reflection on the role of violence in our world.

The following statement is taken from our website:

1. Militarism discourages serious reflection on the moral gravity of war. 

A militaristic culture derives its power from a few basic assumptions:

The military is a force for good;
The military is only used in defense; 
Therefore military service is an honorable profession;
Therefore supporting the troops is a patriotic duty.

We believe these are faulty assumptions.

When we thank veterans for keeping us free and safe, we reassure them that particular, current wars are good, and necessary to keep us free and safe. When we congratulate teenagers for joining the military, we discourage them from considering the spiritual and psychological consequences of violence, enmity, destruction and the taking of human life. When we champion the United States as “the greatest country on Earth,” we overlook the dark side of American history: American exceptionalism provides the rich soil in which militarism takes root.

Militarism creates a convenient blind spot for the terrible costs of war. At its most bold, it dares and encourages young people to sacrifice their lives, and possibly their souls, at the unholy altar of the State.

2. Militarism is a spiritual disease akin to the worshiping of idols. 

The Ten Commandments reads Thou Shall Not Kill; Jesus Christ was the Prince of Peace; and Catholic tradition condemns war in the strongest terms. Manifest Destiny, American Exceptionalism, and Christian Nationalism have no basis in the Catholic understanding of the world. As explained by Cardinal Walter Kasper, an overly strong identification of the Gospel with a particular culture or nation is an “ecclesiological heresy.” Killing does not become okay simply because the killer was wearing the stars and stripes. The Bible makes it very clear that God judges people according to His laws, not Man’s laws.

“Obey God rather than men.” Acts 5:29
“No one man can serve two masters.” Matthew 6:24
“Thou Shalt Have No God Before Me.” Exodus 20:3

Please click this link to read the whole statement.

Boston CAM is an independent grassroots effort. We speak only for ourselves. 

We encourage all Boston-area Catholics who agree with our goals to join even if they are not currently practicing the Faith. Non-Catholics may also join if they have a sincere and respectful interest in Catholicism and Catholic teaching. However, expect anti-Catholic ideas and opinions to be vigorously challenged. Remember, we still have the Catechism.
results.name: Boston Catholics Against Militarism
