results.description:
“Beauty of the Beast: Motorcycles - Art, Form, Function, Freedom”, a new exhibit at the Larz Anderson Auto Museum exploring the motorcycle from an artistic, historic, mechanical and cultural perspective. The year-long exhibit will examine the life history of the motorcycle, from the pioneering 1800’s era - when an engine was simply bolted to a bicycle  – through the present day technological and artistic triumphs achieved by manufacturers in Asia, Europe and the United States, leading to a shift in cultural perceptions, and a world-wide fan base of enthusiasts.  The exhibit features some of the rarest, most technically innovative, historically significant, and beautiful motorcycles of all time, brought together within the context of the history of the automobile, examining technological and style parallels and the evolution of the motorcycle from an inexpensive alternative to the motorcar to a distinct entity and potent social and cultural symbol.  Abounding with visually compelling examples of the impact of the motorcycle on popular culture, the exhibit will recall for the visitor such classics as “Easy Rider”, “The Wild One”, “The World’s Fastest Indian”, and other iconic cinematic portrayals of the motorcycle as the ultimate expression of freedom. Iconic brands such as BMW, Ducati, Harley Davidson, Honda and Indian will be among the featured marques. The competitive speed arena will be well represented at “Beauty of the Beast” with the 1970 Harley Davidson Sportster Powered Streamliner from the Bonneville Motorcycle family, and both the Pro Mod Suzuki TL 1000 and Suzuki Hyabusa motorcycles used by NHRA Pro Stock Motorcycle racer Sam Herwitz, a Newton, MA resident and drag racing legend, all part of the racing and competitive riding section of the exhibit. The very newest, most exotic motorcycles the world factories have to offer, including the Ducati 119
Superleggera “superbike” will be on display as will a complete representation of the century’s best in motorcycling.  Legends like the Vincent Black Shadow from England, a rare MV Augusta, and a historically significant 1935 Morgan Super Sport Three-Wheeler will highlight the evolutionary variations of the motorcycle.  European greats including the 1923 BMW r32, which was part of the Art of the Motorcycle at Guggenheim, acclaimed for rocketing BMW’s motorcycle success with its masterful design concept that would endure the rest of the century, and the 1935 BMW r17, representing the height of the Art Deco movement, will punctuate the mechanical, artistic, design and styling aspects of the Motorcycle.   “Leather and Lace – Women and Motorcycles”, will explore the relationship of women to motorcycles and focus on some outstanding individuals who made history on the seat of their own machine and in the motorcycle world, whether breaking barriers, making their own mark or through outstanding feats of their own.  The “Beauty of the Beast” exhibit runs through the year, concurrently with the popular summer “Lawn Events” auto shows schedule.  Admission is: $10 for adults, $5 children, seniors, and active military.  For more information or to become involved in the exhibit please contact: Sheldon Steele at 617-522-6547, admin@larzanderson.org, or visit:  www.larzanderson.org.  
Larz Anderson Auto Museum   15 Newton Street  Brookline MA 02445
results.name: Bikers Ride to see Brookline Museum Motorcycle Exhibit

topics.name: Order of Bards Ovates and Druids (OBOD)

results.description:
This section is "Under Construction"

Coming this Fall!

Céad Míle Fáilte (one hundred thousand welcomes)

The Forest Path is a study group for individuals interested in learning more about the spiritual tradition known as Druidry. Who were the Druids?? And more importantly who are they today? What does this tradition have to offer you and the world? Join the group to find out. 

Members will gather for monthly "hearthsides" which are pot-luck social gatherings and discussions on a diverse range of topics related to the ancient to the modern understanding of Druidry including its history and folklore, philosophy, theology, environmental and social applications, and how this earth-based spiritual tradition can inform today's global issues. Like many modern pagan traditions, Druidry exists in the sphere of a personal/experiential path, without dogma, that each of us must learn to walk and interpret for ourselves. Seen today more as a "spiritually informed philosophy of life" than a religion in the traditional sense, this path is completely compatible with many lifestyles regardless of your own cultural and/or religions background.

Members will also be invited to participate in the eight sacred seasonal holy days of the Druid calendar, which will be held outdoors in natural settings.

Who should join this group? Anyone interested in learning more about this unique spiritual tradition.

Do you need to be of Celtic ancestry to join? Certainly not. All that is required is an open mind.

Do you need to be a pagan to join? Certainly not. Modern Druidry (often referred to as neo-druidry) is a sophisticated spiritually-informed philosophy and way-of-life more than a traditional "religion" per say and it's ideas can be applied in many dimensions of life regardless of your background. Arising from ancient indo-european sources, yet informed by in modern ideas and constantly evolving, Druidry today transcends eastern and western worldviews as it transcends the spiritual and scientific divides to offer a way of "being in the world" that is firmly grounded by its connection to nature and the environment, yet committed to helping humanity grow towards a more enlightened society.

This is a closed group and only members can see internal content including the locations of events.

Members will be approved based on their expressed desire to particulate actively in social/educational events as well as the more experiential celebrations. Members ought to have the minimum physical constitution and interest to participate in events held outdoors in natural locations under diverse weather conditions. The eight sacred days of the Druid calendar will be celebrated shine barring extreme situations, and if you are only an "indoor celebrant" or have an aversion to getting your shoes and trousers a bit muddy then this group might not be for you. Locations will be accessible to the Boston area as much as possible.

This group is the initial step towards establishing a local "seed group" within the Order of Bards Ovates & Druids (OBOD). Active involvement in the Order's distance-learning training program is highly encouraged but not required, nor is membership in OBOD a requirement for this group. For more information of the Order and its program, visit www.druidry.org 

Events are planned to commence this autumn 2015.

We hope you can join us on this journey.

A oes heddwch?

Stay tuned as more develops.
results.name: The Forest Path: A Druid Study Group

Both of these jams are great for jazz fan who just want to come and enjoy the music!

For Instrumentalists: 

The first Sunday of each month will be a jazz jam will take place from 6:00-8:30 at Artlounge Arlington 1346 Massachusetts Ave, Arlington, MA 02476 

There is a $6 cover and Artlounge serves beer, wine, and food. This jam is for instrumentalists. Keyboard, amps and drums are provided.

For Vocalists:

Singers are encouraged to come to our other monthly jam, Boston Jazz Singer Showcase at Ryles Jazz Club. Come get backed by a pro rhythm section and sing at a real jazz club in front of your peers! This is a great chance for the amateur vocalist to get experience a great band at a real club and also for the pro singer to keep their performing chops up and try out new material. This is not a set week each month. Next ones are 7/21, 8/11, and 9/15. $7 cover  212 Hampshire St, Cambridge
results.name: Morningside Studio Jazz Jams/Events in Arlington & Cambridge

results.description:
OutBreath is a vibrant, growing community in Boston for all LGBTQ people interested in meditation, mindfulness, and Buddhism. We started our journey as an organization in 2009.

OutBreath's mission is to build community and create welcoming events where every person can find inner freedom and outer realization through meditation. We work with meditation centers across all Buddhist lineages to create LGBTQ-affirming meditation classes, workshops, community events, and residential retreats. 

We welcome LGBTQ people of all ages, identities, and backgrounds. Come as you are. Whether you are brand new to meditation, a long-term practitioner or anywhere in between, you are warmly invited!


Also, check out these other OutBreath resources:

Join OutBreath on Facebook!  Join our Facebook community for fun discussions, wisdom, Dharma humor, and info. on events you may enjoy.  https://www.facebook.com/groups/321872711158021/


Sign up for OutBreath emails!  To get the latest/greatest updates on OutBreath, sign up for our email list!  You'll get the information on upcoming OutBreath events and ways you can get involved in OutBreath.  Our email list is strictly private.  It is never shared and used only for monthly member updates.  http://outbreath.us2.list-manage1.com/subscribe?u=8c3b25c5422d40151980cb2b9&id=480dc85c71


Check out OutBreath on the Web!  To see upcoming OutBreath events and, check out our website:  www.outbreath.org. There will be many more developments to come.  Our vision for outbreath.org is to offer many free services for you, including:  

• Curated content on LGBTQ issues

• LGBTQ-specific Dharma talks

• Videos

• Podcasts

• Blogs

• ...and more!


Mediation Classes for Beginners:  If you're brand-new to meditation, OutBreath is the perfect place to get started!  We work with LGBTQ-affirming meditation centers to offer a variety of introductory workshops taught by renowned, local meditation teachers.  Beginner programs are offered in multiple Buddhist lineages.  You'll be joining other LGBTQ friends who are brand new in an LGBTQ-affirming community.  We'll announce beginner's workshops and seminars here on Meetup.  



We look forward to seeing you at an OutBreath event soon!



May all beings have comfort of heart

May all beings be free from suffering

May all beings live in love and in understanding
results.name: OutBreath - LGBTQ Meditation Community

results.description:
First: A little about Pedro.

Pedro is everyone's friend. He is curious about the world. Pedro does not judge, although he might have a humorous thing or two to say about you or himself from time to time. Pedro likes the outdoors and meeting new people. All in all, Pedro is a pretty cool cat, and the best part is the fact that a little bit of Pedro is inside all of us!

The objective of the group is to find your inner Pedro or if you have always known he is there, give him an opportunity to thrive.

We all know how hard it is to meet new people in Beantown, so let's get together and find Pedro!



* Who should join ?

This is a group of friendly, fun loving people, that started as a spin off of a facebook group. Existing members are welcoming and friendly and met through several meetups. This group is created for those who want to meet other great people and in turn bring in the same level of enthusiasm in social interactions. The goal is to have fun and to meet new people that will eventually turn friends, if that is your goal, you should join.

* Why they should join?

Our end goal is to find Pedro (See above). If you think you can have fun doing that, don't wait! This group is catered towards the 20s and 30s, but we will not restrict membership.

* What members can expect?

Our organizers are social, (some of them organize their own meetups) and know how to make people feel comfortable. We will be doing a lot of outdoor activities during the summer and winter will be about some winter sports, some indoor activity etc. Finding Pedro is about staying healthy and active, so a lot of our events will be about exploring/walking/hiking. Let's do it!

results.description:
Do Ukraine, Syria and the South China Sea get your geopolitical mind going? Are you an academic frustrated that New York and Washington are the key cities where foreign policy discussions take place? Are you just concerned about current events, but fed up with screaming TV talking heads, choreographed diplomatic talking points and sensationalism?

The key mission of this group is not "activism," per se, but to increase understanding of global issues via the articulation of well-formed, logical ideas. We reject the politics of symbolism in favor of possibilities and solutions, and aim to restore a decorum, introspection and thoughtfulness to foreign policy (and general political) discussion increasingly lost in the current zeitgeist of social media and television info-tainment.

And so, this group is a resource for anyone in Greater Boston to engage their inner policy wonk, and discuss key issues affecting our world today. Modeled after the French salons of the Enlightenment, the main focus of our meetup will be to allow people to have fun by adding their perspective and interpretation to interesting topics in intimate, low-key settings, with the aim of encouraging high-quality discussion. I will also link to other foreign policy events in the area. It's your world; let your voice be heard!
results.name: Boston Geopolitics and Foreign Policy Salon

results.description:
You are a 20 or 30 something guy who wants to discuss good books and exchange ideas. 

We strive to help each other get the life you want through discussing and applying ideas from people who have already accomplished what we want. 

Our goal for this club is to bring together young men who have a desire to better themselves. The genre of books we will read and discuss will focus around philosophy, relationships, strategy, biographies of great men, career goals, building a business, social enhancement, personal finance, healthy eating and fitness, power dynamics, and how to live a good, meaningful life.

Your Problem: You read great books, they inspire you and get's your brain burning with excitement. But you find few people that you are able to discuss these ideas with. This causes you to stagnant.

Benefit for you: You get to join a group of young, ambitious, intellectual, men who want to learn and grow together. By reading books and then discussing them in a group, you will be able to understand the ideas from a deeper level, learn different perspectives, and strengthen the knowledge into your memory. If you do nothing with the information from books, it's pointless. Our goal is to help each other use books as an Archimedes Lever to become the men we want to be.

If You Are Not A Reader: Don't worry. Everybody has to start somewhere. In fact, beginner's mind can often be a key to unlocking ideas that others completely miss (see: Think Like a Freak). Reading is an activity that has an extremely high Return on Investment, but only if you apply the knowledge. Warren Buffett attributes literally Billions of dollars to his reading of The Intelligent Investor by Benjamin Graham when he was young (One Book = Billions of Dollars). Not a bad ROI :)

Some examples of books that fall within these category:

Man's Search for Meaning- Viktor Frankl

Meditations- Marcus Aurelius

Four Hour WorkWeek- Tim Ferriss

Profiles in Courage- John F. Kennedy 

The Education of Millionaires- Michael Ellsberg

Blue Ocean Strategy- W. Chan Kim and Renee Mauborgne

The Art of War- Sun Tzu

The Paleo Manifesto- John Durant

The Charisma Myth- Olivia Fox Cabane

The Happiness Hypothesis- Jonathan Haidt

Recession Proof Graduate- Charlie Hoehn

Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance- Robert M. Pirsig

Boyd: The Fighter Pilot Who Changed the Art of War- Robert Coram

The 48 Laws of Power- Robert Greene 

I Will Teach You To Be Rich- Ramit Sethi

Where Men Win Glory- John Krakauer
results.name: Boston Gentlemen's Book Club

results.description:
Welcome to the Working Mom’s Playgroup (Parkway Area!)

We are a Chapter of the Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc. which is a nonprofit corporation and a 501(c)3 publicly-supported charity registered with the IRS.

Geographic Region
The Working Mom’s Playgroup (Parkway Area), is geared towards mothers residing in the towns of Roslindale, West Roxbury and the surrounding communities of Jamaica Plain and Hyde Park. We believe it is important for all mothers to foster relationships with fellow moms residing within their close community. Mothers who live outside this catchment area will be encouraged to work with the main corporation, Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc., to develop a chapter in her local area. Women who are not mothers, as well as those living outside of the listed communities who wish to join, are subject to the approval from the Chapter Officers.

Annual Dues
Membership Fees are $25.00, to be paid within 1 month of joining and renew annually.

Types of activities
The types of activities that will be found on our calendar will increase as our playgroup grows. We will begin with those listed under the Connections category and will increase as members express their desires and interests.

Connections:
We will provide opportunities for moms, children and families to meet and develop relationships. These activities are the ‘core’ of the WMPlaygroup.
Examples: Age-Based Playgroups, New Member Only events, Coffee Chat, Family events, Friday Play Dates and additional age-based play dates, Mom’s Night In (MNI), Mom’s Night Out (MNO), Cooking Together.

Enrichment:
We hope to provide opportunities to which enrich the lives of mothers, families and children within our group as well as in the larger community.
Examples: Book Chat, Arts and Crafts, Parenting Workshops, Discussion Groups, etc.

Health and Fitness:
We hope to provide opportunities for members to engage in group activities based upon living a healthy lifestyle.
Examples: Biggest Loser Challenge, Weight Loss Support, Couch 2 5K running group, Hikes, charity and team walks/runs, group fitness classes, etc.

Community Outreach:
We hope to provide opportunities for moms to support charitable, humanitarian and social welfare projects related to mothers, families and children and to teach children to think about the needs of others.
Examples: Gifts for Kids, No Kid Hungry Bake Sales, Collection Drives (coats, Halloween Costumes, Non-Perishable Foods, etc.)

Events:
As our group grows we hope to organize special and annual events.
Examples: Family Halloween Costume Party, Vendor Event, Mom’s Only Winter Party, Summer Family Picnic, Mani/Pedi Night, etc.

Communications
The Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc. utilizes Meetup.com, private Facebook groups and personal email to communicate with Members as well as for Members to communicate with each other.

Get Involved
Because this is a "meetup" group, participation is expected. By joining our group you are making a commitment to yourself, your children, and our members to attend events.There are many ways to get involved: whether it’s attending events that have been posted to the calendar, participating in social media discussions or joining the leadership team. You will find many opportunities for the WMPlaygroup to enrich your life.
results.name: The Working Mom's Playgroup (Parkway area)

results.description:
The goal of this group is to bring together people who are currently in the process (or want to start the process) of building a side business with the end goal of full automation and passive income.  We have regularly-attending members earning everywhere from $0/mo who are still trying to formulate their goals and ideas, up to $200,000/yr in profit with established customer bases.  So no matter what level you're at, you're welcome to attend our meetings.

Starting an online business with the goal of full automation is often a lonely road with nobody but nay-sayers in town and a bunch of over-hyped "gurus" online.  Yeah, everyone loves the idea of it, but VERY few are willing to actually put in the time, resources, and energy necessary to make it a reality.  This Meetup aims to bring together THOSE people in an effort to increase each of their chances of success.

This is NOT a group for someone who wants to make the next "big thing," has some "paradigm shifting" idea, or who wants to make millions in the stock market or real estate.  This is just for people who are trying to make cash with simple, tested business models that are easy to outsource, automate, and monitor remotely.  Lifestyle is the goal - not a $10,000,000 house and a 90 hour work week.

Examples

• Bloggers

• Podcasters

• Affiliate marketers

• Niche store owners

• Etsy, Amazon and Ebay sellers

• Online course creators

• The list goes on...


Each week, we do two things at our remote meetings, which we hold through Google Hangouts:

1) Accountability check-up (15 minutes): Each member talks about whether or not they accomplished their goals from the last week, sets goals for the upcoming week (which we keep tack of on our discussion boards), and recaps what is helping them or holding them back.

2) Couch of Insight (60 minutes): one member talks about what problems they're having, and the whole group focuses on how to help that member overcome those problems by being brutally honest and offering help wherever possible.

We also share a tremendous number of resources, including thousands of dollars-worth of subscriptions, books, software, access to courses, in addition to our personal contacts and experience.  We put our money where our mouth is when it comes to helping our fellow members.

Most people never have the guts to try what we are doing, or they don't think it's possible.  But if you're still reading this, you probably already know:

"Whether or not you think you can, you're right." -Henry Ford


I look forward to meeting you,

-Dave

Organizer


Important Note: This group is capped at 50 members. We are going for quality over quantity. If you join the group, you're going to get a tremendous amount of value.  But we can only offer this because our members actually participate and help each other succeed.  Therefore, if a member goes two entire months with zero activity (no messages, RSVPs, or meetings attended), I'll message that member. If I don't get a reply to that message, the member may be removed from the group so that others may join. This is not a ban from the group, and anyone removed in this way may re-join. 

PS: our weekly meetings are held on Google Hangouts at a link you can find in the hangout descriptions.  However, if you want to simply hang out with some other folks in the group, the following Google Hangout is kept open 24/7 for use by anyone in the group (or who may be interested in joining the group).

https://hangouts.google.com/call/dq4qhhdefftaq3fmqwij2ipe2ea
results.name: Automated Income Mastermind Group

results.description:
The Boston Entrepreneur Online Marketing Business Network or simply the Boston MindStormers is all about learning how to use Online Marketing to get leads and customers for your product/s or business.

Richardson and Eu Ching are here to show you the possibilities available to the regular person to building an online business in whatever industry you choose.

Get Meetup updates and Online businessbuilding and marketing tips here!

As a member of this group, you will learn real tactics and strategies for using the internet to grow your small business.

When it comes to marketing on the interwebs, your website has one of two purposes:

1) As a Lead Generation tool (that you can follow up with on the phone or by email etc)

2) As an ecommerce site, to sell your products directly from your site.

What goal you have depends on what type of business you are running, but whichever it is, this group is for you if:

- You don’t have the slightest clue what you are doing when it comes to internet marketing, BUT you are open to learning.

- You don’t yet have a website, but would like one, and would like to know how to get one made.

- You do have a website, but can’t get any traffic to it.

- You are getting traffic, but you can’t get any leads or sales (you have no conversions) - You would like to meet other people who are making money online (and are willing to share what they are doing)

- You have heard of the whole ‘social media trend’ and how marketing your business on sites like Facebook can be very powerful but you don’t know how to do it.

- You are successfully generating leads and making sales online, and would love to share your strategies with others who are also getting great results, so you can all benefit.

Frequently Asked Questions:

1) “Who created this group?”

We did – Richardson Archil and Eu Ching ANG.

Richardson Archil is a Go-getting, Kick ass Writer, Self-speaker, Poet & Comedian. Totally motivated & dedicated to achieving his goals!

Eu Ching is a Work-at-Home Mom - I assist my husband in the management of his medical clinic as well as running a successful internet marketing home business. I have 3 kids, 2 dogs, 2 turtles, countless fish, a visiting stray cat and run 3 blogs - MomsWisdom.net (parenting), TheEntrepreneurMom.com (Find your Inner Mogul) & BetterFamilyHealth.org (Get off your Tush & Exercise! My hubby's medical blog).

2) “Why have you created this group?”

There are 3 reasons for forming this group:

- Some of the best ideas have come from a mastermind (a small group that shares ideas). There are a lot of internet marketers in Boston who would love to meet others who ‘speak their language’, but up until now, have never had.

- We love teaching. At each meet up, we will teach a new internet marketing strategy (eg Facebook pay per click, writing an automated email follow-up etc) I also plan to record each one of these sessions and share them with my own list and with members of the group who missed out.

- We would like to offer people quality information that actually works. Anything you learn in this group is proven to work

– We only share what has worked for us. This is unlike some groups out there, where there’s usually someone up on stage who’s never made money online in his life, talking as if he has (usually to sell their ‘make money online’ course)

3) How many people usually show up?

To be honest, this is still a small group – so not too many. But that‘s usually good because it means you will get a lot more 1-on-1 attention if you need it, and we can keep things very informal. Eg. You can bring along your laptop and get individual attention, or show the group what you are working on.

4) How long do the Meetups usually go for?

Generally around 2 hours. We can meet around 7pm and likely finish 9ish. But you are welcome to leave early or stay later, it’s entirely up to you.

5) Does it cost anything to attend?

Nope. The meetups are free and we intend to keep it that way.

6) What if I don’t know anything about internet marketing – Am I still welcome to come?

Absolutely. Most people who attend are just starting out so don’t feel like you have to be some internet marketing geek like us to be a member.

7) Do I need to participate, or can I just watch?

It’s up to you. If you just want to watch the presentations, that’s fine, of course. But if you have questions/comments and would like to join the conversation, that’s also encouraged.

8) How do I know when the next meetup is being held – Where are those details?

Just bookmark this site right now. As long as you check back every few days, you will see where and when the next meetup is.

Also you can join as a member, it’s free! Then you will get an email as soon as we announce the times and locations of the next meetup.

We only have one rule:

Please don’t use these meetings to pitch your business. You are welcome to tell others what you do of course, but there is a huge difference between self-promotion and being so aggressive about it that it scares off our new members ;D

That’s about it. If you are still reading, then you are obviously interested in learning about this stuff. So why not come along to our next meetup? Who knows? You could get one idea that increases your bottom line by 20% this year, or you could meet someone you end up doing a JV with.

But you will only know if you show up.

See you there,

Richardson & Eu Ching

PS Get Meetup updates and Online businessbuilding and marketing tips here!

results.description:
The purpose of this Meetup is to bring regular meetings discussing Socionics to Boston.

Socionics is superficially similar to the Myers Briggs Type Indicator, but conceptually is deeply different. We hope to have a lively discussion about the model's content, application in practice, to deepen our understanding of the system, and to see in what ways the ideas of socionics can help us to see ourselves and others more clearly. 

Anyone with an interest in psychology, spirituality, or typology is welcome to join. Beginners are welcomed. The only requirement is an open mind. 

The most interesting part of Socionics is dedicated to the intertype relations research. Each personality type, according to Socionics, has a specific core relationship to each other personality type. The theory suggests that some personality types are more and the others are less psychologically compatible based on their personality differences. Socionics dating grows in popularity day by day as more people learn about this intertype relationship theory and gain valuable insights in their private and working relationships. This group is for people to learn and discuss Socionics for the purpose of self-typing and self-discovery, to find the right partner whether it is for a short or long term relationship, to improve their current social, familial, and romantic relationships, and most definitely to connect to other people who are interested in examining their lives and relationships through the Socionical lens.

With this group, you'll be able to find out your Socionics type and learn more about your strengths, values and attitudes towards the world around you, and how you interact with those of different types. 

To find out more about Socionics, check out our Introduction to Socionics.

We also have a Facebook group.

Be sure to join our wider community at World Socionics Society.

Finally PLEASE support our meetup group by pledging a pound or two per month at our Patreon page.
results.name: Boston Socionics Society

topics.name: Career Advice, Career Help, Interview Skills

results.description:
Along with moving and buying a house, searching for a job is commonly listed by many authorities as one of the most stressful times of your life.  The task is so challenging that some say the first thing you should do is get a good night sleep!  In this group I'm taking a different approach: one that is based on scientific method.  I believe that the work you need to do can be distilled down to a rational approach where you create a plan and a means for it's execution. 

I come from a support group background so my approach is somewhat more enlightened and creative than most.  I believe in empowerment of the individual together with the advice and support of others to help lift the spirit and facilitate growth.  This group will begin each time with a check-in that's like a round robin.  We'll briefly introduce ourselves and then begin to address the agenda for the meeting.  Groups can range in time duration from 1 - 1.5 hours.

My plan is to start out with a simple format and then scale as needs and interest arise.  In addition to support and advice, you can expect to network with others, benefit from their contacts as they benefit from yours.  In time we will be creating workshops in various topic areas like resume writing, mock interviews, and creative ways you can get an interview.  I will also be drawing on other group members to contribute more in the  future.  This is a great opportunity to: gain visibility, fill resume gaps, and get a good reference.  If you are interested in volunteering, let me know. 

My background is extensive and multifaceted.  I've had a number of different jobs and careers including volunteer work and leadership.  I've worked for large companies and small, non-profits, educational institutions as well as for myself.  I went to Tufts University where I earned a bachelor's and master's degrees.  I have group leadership experience that includes formal facilitation training.  I've helped others create plans with action items and counseled them on how the can achieve fulfilling work that is compatible with their needs and lifestyle.

Not Allowed:  third party recruiters, pyramid-like scheme advocates etc.  If your intent is to market and/or sell products and services to group members then you don't belong in this group.  No Exceptions.
results.name: CareerLab

results.description:
I almost called this group “30-somethings in forgotten Norfolk County.” That’s because this club is really about making a go of it in the small towns of Norfolk County. I’m talking about Plainville, Foxboro, Sharon, Franklin, Stoughton, Dover, Medfield (what IS Medfield? Does it exist? According to Wikipedia it does, but I want more proof). It should be a smell-the-details revolving tour of these towns, an honest attempt to find vitality in old New England stiffness. I can totally see us grabbing some bar pizza in Randolph before heading off to a movie in a nearby theater. Or just hanging out in a members’ place watching films, listening to music, cooking, or just talking about nothing at all. Or maybe going on that hiking trail no one else knows about, or having potlucks, or…

We’ll go to Brookline, Newton and Quincy, sure, but the main focus is for 30-somethings living in the towns to have some fun without the foregone (forlorn?) conclusion of driving to Boston. The odds were against me, but I scratched the suburban surface and still found some real winners (including a full-blown Greek restaurant many falafels ahead of any Zagat-stamped establishment in Boston). I even managed to see Double Indemnity at the Patriot Place Showcase Theater! That’s right, the home of Tom “Ballgazi” Brady! I’d like to discover your down-home finds too. I know they’re out there.

Some ground rules: no meetup will be held unless at least four people register for it (me plus three others), and, well, ya gotta be in your 30s and living in Norfolk county.  Anyone who doesn't fill out where in Norfolk they're from in their meetup profile will not be approved for the group :(

---------------------------------

A little about your fearless leader:

  -I’m originally from Arlington, so I know the value of Greek pizza.  I think Villa House of Pizza’s pizza drippings are still skidding across my arteries.

  -I’m deeply info films, especially of the 1970s.

  -I’m a single 30-something working professional living in a bedroom community.  My acceptance of this varies.  I’ll let the Isley Brothers sum up my feelings best: “My patience comes and goes, but my living has got to go on.”

  -I’m a native Bay-stater, but only recently tried bar pizza.  I’m gonna learn more.

  -I’ve started cooking (mostly Chinese).  The Chinese were really onto something good with the wok.

  -I watch Columbo episodes on Netflix to wind down for the night – still painting the town red after all these years!

Some films I've been thinking a lot about lately...

1.  Detour – oh, such a marvelous, cynical, pulpy, fatalistic, flea-bitten no-budget wonder!  The sh*t-luck the main character has draped around him is a must-see mix of the comedic and the tragic.  The best noir I’ve seen.

2. Little Odessa: dark and pallid urban nightmare movie about the Russian mob in NYC, but with a liquid, poetic visual style and startling performances by Tim Roth and Eddie Furlong(!).

3.  American Heart (Eddie Furlong again!  Wow, his career DID NOT peak with T2!).

4.  Boxer’s Omen – unimaginable strangeness from Hong Kong. 

5.  The Friends of Eddie Coyle – It’s got Robert Mitchum as a small-time con who’s on the home stretch of a vague and rotten life.  In Boston.  In the ‘70s.  It can’t be bad: in fact, it’s one of the best films of the ‘70s.

6.  The Honeydripper – such a sweet little film from John Sayles.  He still writes some of the best characters in film.

7.  The Station Agent – a marvel of modern filmmaking: a film that takes its time with its characters and doesn’t make life out to be anything more than it is.  Such a treasure.

8.  Massacre at Central High – if you think this is another “teenagers run amok” film, think again, bucko.  You don’t know the half of it.

9.  Over the Edge – another film you’d swear was just more juvenile delinquent fodder.  But for my money, this one’s far more realistic and unflinching in its depiction of the desperate restlessness of being a teenager (the swelling of lust, the mystery and gnashing frustration of girls, the confused violence that breeds in boys, and the foul rejection of/by parents) than just about any other film.  And it’s got perhaps the most perfect end credits music ever.

10.  Trial and Error – a real charmer, this one.  Jeff Daniels is likeable as always, Michael Richards has the physical comedy bit down to a science, and Charlize Theron is so adorable she has healing powers.

Music that I've been listening to lately........

-Isley Brothers

-The Orb

-Aphex Twin

-Coroner

-Pet Shop Boys

-Madonna

-Frank Zappa

-Isaac Hayes

-Weather Report

-Jimi Hendrix

-A mix of 80s/90s one-hit wonders: Ce-Ce Peniston/Aqua/Stevie B./Jane Child/Double
results.name: 30-Somethings Living in Norfolk County

results.description:
NESFA is one of the oldest SF clubs in the nation. The convention that NESFA runs, Boskone, is also one of the oldest in the country. The NESFA clubhouse is located at 504 Medford Street in Somerville.
NESFA hosts a variety of events at the clubhouse in the course of a month. All events at the clubhouse are free to anyone. You don't have to be a member and you do not have to join. All you have to do is open the door and walk in. Game Days, Game Nights, Media Days, Book Discussion Group, the Annual Picnic, the Halloween party, the Bah Humbug game day, and the general Wednesday night gathering are all free to attend. Details for each will be posted in each event listing.
Boskone runs in February, and it's one of the longest running SF conventions out there. Many famous authors attend each year, along with editors and publishers. There are discussion panels, nightly events, an art show, filkers, a dealer's room, and I personally run the game room.
NESFA is also the parent organization of NEGC (New England Gaming Convention). Two have run thus far. Both were 1-day gaming cons.
NESFA Press is the publishing wing of NESFA. NESFAns handle all aspects of the work, from the negotiations to the editing.
You'll see NESFA set up at the Boston Book Festival as well.
info@nesfa.org is the general email address for nesfa. You can also contact me at my email address. The web address is www.nesfa.org  
To get to the clubhouse, you can take the 80 bus (drops you off a block away in either direction), and the 89 bus (drops you off on Broadway. Cross Broadway and go past the lights. NESFA will be on your right). There is a small lot in the back for cars (first come, first served) and metered parking on the street. I look forward to seeing you at the various events and thank you for taking the time to check out NESFA.
results.name: New England Science Fiction Association

results.description:
Practicing deep embodied listening  ~ Cultivating the freedom to follow your impulses   ~   Allowing movement to unfold, accessing wisdom, guidance and creative powers 

Authentic Movement (AM) is a simple and profound moving meditation Practice. It engages the innate, fluid wisdom of consciousness expressing as the body. Through a variety of simple structures, moving with eyes closed, and embodied witnessing, we practice paying attention through sensory-feeling awareness. AM invites us to experience our body’s true spontaneous moment to moment expression, to lead us into stillness, sound and movement and deepening states of awareness. As we allow our body to unwind and share its own secret language, we discover aspects of ourselves and our lives from fresh perspectives. We emerge enlivened, nourished, integrated and refreshed.

No previous experience with Authentic Movement is necessary, just a willingness to enter into the unknown within a safely held circle. Bring comfortable clothes and a journal for writing/drawing. Art supplies will be available. For more information about Authentic Movement, see the Authentic Movement Community blog: http://authenticmovementcommunity.org/about
results.name: Authentic Movement: A Moving Meditation Practice

results.description:
There once dwelt one of whom Masters hailed as "The Master of Masters." This man, if "man" indeed he was, dwelt in Egypt in the earliest days. He was known as Hermes Trismegistus, thrice great. He was the father of the Occult Wisdom; the founder of Astrology; the discoverer of Alchemy and considered to be a God of Wisdom. 

 The term "hermetic" reflects upon a "secret" "sealed so that nothing can escape" by reason of the fact that the followers of Hermes always observed the principle of secrecy in their teachings. They did not believe in "casting pearls before swine," but rather held to the teaching "milk for babes"; "meat for strong men," both of which maxims are familiar to readers of the Christian scriptures, but both of which had been used by the Egyptians for centuries before the Christian era. 

 It's said that few pass the torch throughout the ages to keep the wisdom teachings alive and with integrity. Let's gather together as adepts, initiates, teachers, students & novices of Hermetics as the spiritual warriors of light in an effort to continue the tradition of the flame holders and keep the magick alive. 

Meetups may include:

• Classes on Self Mastery rooted in ancient wisdom teachings

• meditations

• community gatherings

• Reflection upon Hermetic & Occult books (call it a book club) 

• Hermetic moon ceremonies

• Solstice celebrations

• Spiritual Alchemy

• Hermetic healing

• Astrology 

• Tarot


*Note: Code of ethics for the brother & sisterhood of light

one should be disciplined, balanced, amiable towards everyone, know thyself, practice self control (not on drugs or alcohol at meetups) respect the privacy and boundaries of other members and most of all...develop the ability to use your Will & Imagination to set your mind in motion.

The location can be at my wellness center in Acton and will be kept private so non-members can't see where we meet.
results.name: Acton Hermetic Occult and Esoteric Meetup

results.description:
Dr. Joseph Warren, a once famous Boston patriot, is largely forgotten in his home town of Boston.

The purpose of this meetup group is to add visibility of Dr. Warren on Boston's Freedom Trail. 

You should have an active interest in Boston revolutionary history, a knowledge of Dr. Warren's accomplishments. 

We will have field trips to scope out suggested locations where possible Dr. Warren plaques, statues, or historic placards can be placed.  There will also be conversations with local authors and historians that share our objective of more visibility for Dr. Warren.  The group will decide on the social components of  any of our activities, 

We will meet and decide which of our various suggested projects to focus on, and with a small team, find and influence decision makers.

The only physical mention of Dr. Warren on Boston's Freedom Trail is at Bunker Hill. His statue there is beautiful and fitting as he was killed in that famous battle, but it is the last stop on the Trail. Many historic tours do not mention him at all despite his enormous contributions to the Patriot cause.
results.name: Where is Dr. Joseph Warren?

topics.name: Divorced Support For Men and Fathers

results.description:
Considering Divorce? Overwhelmed by the divorce process? 

There is nothing easy about divorce. We recognize how difficult and overwhelming this process is, and we have created this group to help people become better educated about legal and financial divorce issues in a low-key, supportive, no pressure atmosphere. If you are considering divorce or are in the early stages of divorce, you may be able to benefit from this group. 

With the guidance of a family law attorney and mediator and a Certified Divorce Financial Analyst™, we hope you will gain a better understanding of the divorce landscape in Massachusetts. Armed with this knowledge, you should be able to make informed decisions and better protect your assets, your family, and your emotional well-being. We will discuss issues surrounding the division of assets, the tax impact of various scenarios, an overview of the court process, child custody, alimony, health insurance, pensions, retirement assets, brokerage accounts, the marital home, and Social Security. 

An understanding of all your options at the outset of the divorce process can potentially save you from embarking down the wrong legal path, creating unnecessary antagonism, and incurring exorbitant legal bills. Please RSVP, as seating is limited. Admission is free.
results.name: Considering Divorce? Overwhelmed? Learn the issues/options!

results.description:
Looking for a fun place to play cribbage? Want to learn about a card game that's over 400 years old in a fun, competitive environment? Then come on by to the Somerville Skunks, an American Cribbage Congress sanctioned club.

We play every Tuesday evening from 6-9pm, which each session consisting of 9 games of cribbage, at the Irish American Club on 177 West Street in Malden. Guests play for $10/week for the first 4 weeks, then can become a member of the ACC (America's Cribbage sanctioning body) to play at the members rate, which entitles you to participate in tournaments nationwide as well as local and regional Grass Roots tournaments where you can win cash prizes. So what are you waiting for? Come join the Somerville Skunks and play the coolest two-person card and board game in history! For more information, contact John at linemanjohn13@gmail.com or call anytime at 617-501-7893.

The Club has a full bar on site, and parking in the back.
results.name: Somerville Skunks Cribbage Club @ Irish American Club Malden

results.description:
Welcome to the Multilingual Conversation Exchange!

Many of us here in Waltham want to improve and practice our language skills yet it's often difficult to find a place, time, and the energy to organize people. With this goal in mind, I've created this Meetup Group. It's completely free and will meet regularly --- if you're looking to improve your Spanish, German, and French, and later even other languages, then you're on the right page.

I'm bilingual, fluent in both English and Spanish, and would like to improve my German and French. I created my first Meetup Group when I was living in Germany and it was a lot of fun. Here's an idea of how the setup has worked in the past: 

1. The group practices speaking a language for 30 minutes and then switches. Usually the group will naturally break down into 3-4 smaller groups practicing whatever languages they choose.
2. You may also practice your language of choice for the entire session if you find someone who also wishes to practice that language.
3. If we all wish to practice one language, e.g. French, we can speak French the entire time!

Join the group to meet cool new people, learn about their cultures and stories, discuss interesting topics, and to progress in your comprehension and speaking in different languages. All levels are welcome.

This group is FREE! The only thing you pay for is your drink or food at the café.

Hope to see you soon!

Regards,
Stefanie
results.name: Multilingual Conversation Exchange: German, Spanish, French

results.description:
Swords are Fun! That's are school motto. And the most important reason to join us.

Athena School of Arms is a Boston-based school that studies and trains Historical European Martial Arts. We teach two styles: the Longsword tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer and the Scottish tradition Broadsword and Smallsword.

Athena fencers are motivated towards a demanding physical and intellectual goal. It is not simply enough to improve athletically - the study of historical arts requires a commitment to documents written hundreds of years ago, frequently in another language. In short: we are nerds.

And fencing is a thinking sport; there are tactics and strategy to go along with the history.

Many Historical fencers are fans of science fiction or fantasy literature. Many of us are gamers. Now we have a physical activity which links our other passions into one awesome life. And introduces us to other members of the same community.

Athena fencers show up with a wide variety of backgrounds and skills in physical activities. And wide variety of shapes and sizes. Some are former modern fencers or kendoka. Others have never before found a sport they liked. The classes are small and always tailored to make sure everyone can succeed.

You should join Athena School of Arms because you want to fight with swords. And to become more fit. And to learn about healthy exercise for life. And for an intellectually challenging activity. And to hit people with swords.

A typical class is 75 minutes long. We start with 30 minutes of physical preparation. A warm-up is followed by work on either agility or speed. Then we have a Power and Core circuit.

Then we have the actual sword curriculum. Every class starts with footwork. Attacks and defenses are developed. Progressively more protective gear and higher intensity are introduced to move towards understanding the historical fight.

We also regularly engage in free play and have monthly, friendly class tournaments. And these are followed by all going out to dinner together.

It is amazing to see some of the friendships developed within the school. Most of us were invited to the weddings of 3 different members.

Athena School of Arms also works to reconstruct the Dagger, Sword and Buckler, and Grappling arts. Training includes free play, drills, test cutting, and physical fitness; together, these elements help students to understand and recreate combat on the battlefield, the list, and in personal defense.

Starting in the 14th century the people who trained in the use of the sword started to write down the instruction they received in the art of fencing. Our group, and groups like ours from all over the world, work to reconstruct the Historical European Martial Arts. And they are martial arts. What we do is not choreographed and we use realistic weapon simulators. We put on appropriate, modern protective gear and fence at high-intensity.
results.name: Athena School of Arms - Historical Swordsmanship

results.description: A meetup group for learners and users of Apache Flink in the Boston Area. Apache Flink is the next evolutionary step in distributed compute engines of the Hadoop ecosystem. Apache Flink is a Next-Gen Big Data Analytics framework which is an alternative to MapReduce, Apache Storm and Apache Spark. Apache Flink is a community-driven open source framework for scalable stream and batch processing of Big Data. Apache Flink provides an execution engine, several APIs in Java and Scala and domain-specific libraries for Machine learning and large scale graph processing (Gelly). Flink integrates well with other open source tools for data input and output as well as deployment. Some key advantages of Apache Flink are: • True Low latency streaming engine (not micro-batches!) that unifies batch and streaming in a single Big Data processing framework • Automatic Cost-Based Optimizer ( little re-configuration and little maintenance for Flink Applications!) • Memory management ( no more frequent Out Of Memory errors!) • Native closed-loop iteration operators making graph and machine learning applications run much faster • Hadoop and Storm compatibilities layers to preserve your investment in Hadoop MapReduce and Storm and simply run your legacy code on Flink
results.name: Boston Area Apache Flink Meetup

results.description:
I am so happy to be starting this meet-up, Farm to Table Dining with friends! Our events will consist of relaxing and rustic outdoor “al fresco” dinners, luncheons, brunches, benefits for a cause, pot luck dinners and themed events. Outdoor dining, pretty tablescapes, and creative entertaining is my joy, so join us for fresh homemade recipes made from locally grown food, and get ready to pass the dishes family style! Come Join us in a garden or for "on location" dinners at a farm, winery, by the sea, or who knows where we will enjoy girl time, our options are endless!  So don't  be surprised if there are cows nearby or a pumpkin patch,  that's one of the things that makes farm to table dining so special!  

Our dinners exclusively for the ladies will be held at least once monthly (maybe twice knowing we have to grab good weather when we can in New England ) and usually kept to an intimate group of 12, but open to larger groups for some  “on location” FARM TO TABLE dining.  Some  events could possibly be posted with other meet up groups. Other easy social gatherings may just include coffee and a dessert table or a cocktail and hordorve evening huddled around the campfire.  I welcome you all to my garden for some of these events, and would love if a member has a garden to share for hosting.   My hope is for all of us to share great recipes and conversation in the great outdoors under the stars!  Please, ladies who are involved in catering are encouraged to join!  We will use you!

Check out our Recipe Share page!Recipe Share Page

The pricing of the dinners /luncheons will vary based on the themes of the season and menu offerings.  With increased meet-up fees of 20./month I have had to follow suite as most groups and add  10.00 year meet-up dues.  Most of the dinners are BYOB, but others may include wine , a beverage or a special cocktail. 


Dine with us by candlelight with linens and fresh flowers, taste various cheeses, local wine and seafood, pass the pasta and dip your bread, all while sitting at a hand built farm table. ( yes we built a 10 footer!) Just imagine eating lovely fresh food and produce without the box and without the preservatives, all while enjoying beautiful outdoor settings.  You're senses for fresh food will be rejuvinated and we know everything tastes so much better outside.  So don't be surprised to hear a cow moo in the background while you enjoy the fresh air and listen to the robins sing.   I look forward to sharing it all, starting this tradition of wholesome farm to table dining, and having you join us for wonderful dining experiences. 

FARM TO TABLE REFERENCE BLOG  Farm table page, and our RECIPE Share page! 

P. S.  this is one meet-up where overalls and straw hats make common sense! 😉
results.name: FARM TO TABLE DINING WITH FRIENDS

I want to welcome anyone who feels they are being controlled by their financial state. It can be quite daunting, I know I have been there and happily found my way out. In the process I discovered my secret to success and works not just for finances, it works for anything holding you back. This system I discovered I call "the new Alpha-Omega System for Personal Finance Management" where you will begin learning to be financially free. I am now ready to share it with others. This group will meet in a local coffee shop once a week, if you are interested I hope you will join me.

The purpose of this group is to build confidence and let you know you are not alone.  With the right mentoring you may even see that you are not as bad off as you think.  The support of this group is meant to take you to the next level.  It will help you to live within your own means and never look back. Learn how to restructure your life to be more healthy, less financially focused, and achieve a lighter feeling.  We will meet bi-weekly to discuss how to update your financial future using the new technique I discovered that has helped me move forward and never look back.  My system works, but you must be committed to focusing on what you already have.  It may not be much, but truly - it really is ENOUGH!

topics.name: For Folks to Meet and Greet with other Small Dogs

results.description:
Calling all extra small dogs and friends (15 pounds and under) and their owners! I'd love for my Giggles and Chipper to meet other very small, full-grown dogs (puppies are also invited as long as they will be around 15 pounds or under fully grown)! 

Check out our photos from past Meetups. All small dogs that have good doggy manners and are polite with other dogs of any breed or mix are invited. Please be sure your dog(s) are healthy and up-to-date with shots, heart worm and flea & tick medication.  Come join our fun and friendly group! 

Providing your dog with a consistent routine of ongoing socialization is a key to maintaining their well-being and to preventing many behavior issues, specifically those due to boredom, lack of confidence, and stress. Learning good social skills leads to a healthy and happy dog! 

So we'll meet at least once a month for a walk in Bird Park (we have FREE use of a huge indoor space in Norwood, MA for the cold weather) and we'll see what other pooch play events we can also schedule. Feel free to email me with any of your own ideas! We can also meet sometimes at Panera Bread (they allow dogs on their patio!) for some food and drink afterward. We might even do some pup sitting for each other and a sharing of ideas!

Because of allergies that some dogs have, no food or treats are allowed during the time we meet indoors.

Attend any of our fun Meetups and your dog will thank you with wags of gratitude! 

PLEASE only join if you are serious about attending our group and PLEASE change your RSVP if your plans do change. 

Feel free to click the GREEN "Chip In" Button on the left side of the page to help pay for my costs of the Meetup each year. Thank you in advance!

Please see my other fun Meet-up, Let's Laugh Today based on Laughter Yoga. These Meetups are a fun time for any age and any level of physical ability and some are also free: http://www.meetup.com/Lets-Laugh-Today-based-on-Laughter-Yoga/ or www.letslaughtoday.com

Please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns about either of these Meetups. Hope to meet you soon!

Linda

email: linda@letslaughtoday.com

A typical meeting might include a meditative practice, a deep feeling experience, some instruction or modeling of various practices and lots of fun, along with collaboration!

results.description: This group is for individuals with a vested interest in optimizing the performance of their software applications and their user's digital experience, by instrumenting best practices in pre-production, as well as post-production, from all digital platforms (i.e. - browser, mobile, tablet, cloud, etc.). We will also address quick resolution of production incidents and deep dive diagnostics, as well as future capacity planning, predictive analytics, and business intelligence. In reviewing these topics, the main goal of the APM & DXO group will be to define the success of these initiatives from their impact on key business metrics (such as revenue, conversion rates, cost savings, etc.). An additional important goal of this group is to build a bridge between people from different business disciplines. All are welcome, from software engineers, devops, marketing, and general business professionals.

results.description:
This is a meetup for {Cmd, Jl, R, Py, Matlab} Stan users. The plan is to have talks, Q & A sessions, and workshops.

Stan (http://mc-stan.org) is a probabilistic programming language implementing full Bayesian statistical inference with 

• MCMC sampling (NUTS, HMC)

and penalized maximum liklelihood estimation with

•  Optimization (L-BFGS)

Stan is coded in C++ and runs on all major platforms (Linux, Mac, Windows).

Stan is freedom-respecting, open-source software (new BSD core, GPLv3 interfaces).

Many thanks to R Studio for their support of the meetup group.
results.name: Stan Users - Boston/Camberville

We welcome everyone who is interested in Rationality and keen to apply tools to solve their everyday problems. We will meet to discuss specific topics, find practical ways to make use of them, and support each other's progress. 

If you're new to the Rationality community, we recommend reading Eliezer Yudkowsky's fictional book Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality (HPMOR) and his non-fiction book Rationality: AI to Zombies. Both are available online.

Please bring something to write with and on to our workshops. We will do exercises and brainstorming in addition to intellectual discussion.

Our game nights are more social and casual. If you aren't sure if this meetup is right for you, we recommend starting with a game night.

topics.name: Personal and Professional Growth and Development

results.description:
The National Association of Asian American Professional (NAAAP) Boston Chapter is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization whose mission is to cultivate and empower leaders for professional excellence, connect accomplished professionals for mutual success, engage and participate with the community-at-large, and inspire leaders to make a meaningful difference in government, education, business, and society.

As part of the NAAAP National organization, NAAAP Boston is the largest and fastest growing Asian American professional organization in Greater Boston. Through its nine committees, members can participate in many activities that bring together other Asian American professionals in the community. 

Our history goes back to New York when the first chapter was founded in 1982. Boston founded its chapter in 1986. There are 27 active Chapters and Associate Chapters across the country with a growing membership of over 3000. Currently, NAAAP Boston is one of the largest chapters, with over 350 members. With an active Asian American community, NAAAP Boston is present at many events across the city.

Join NAAAP Boston now!

Right now the third or fourth Tuesday is good.  We will then vote on the book for the next month.  Here is a list of the books: Here is a list of books that appear on the show: http://www.nypl.org/blog/2012/02/27/mad-men-reading-list.

Boston is making major moves towards becoming a respected, fashionable city so, let's support the events that are helping Boston become recognized for style! Next up......BOSTON FASHION WEEK 2015!!!
results.name: Boston Fashion Design Meetup

results.description:
Welcome to ADAM, a safe space for men to interact, bond, and express themselves in a way that feels most natural to them. ADAM is a closed group, so if you happened upon this page by accident you will need to reach out to the organizer (Patrick) to inquire. This group was inspired by an expressed need for a group where like-minded men can spend time with each other while enhancing personal growth, relationships, and spiritual connection through socialization, discussion, and activities. Our group is not intended to compete with other similar groups, but to support each other in offering content which supplements one another's programming. ADAM will act to support our brothers in each of our unique ways of expressing our maleness. Through interaction and creative expression we will strive to be our most authentic selves in an open, non-judgmental setting. In this space, you are welcome and encouraged to define and express who you are by your own truth and definition. You may find that your own expression of who you are as a man (i.e. what appeals to you, how you present, act or behave) conflicts with what is outlined by others to be appropriate or acceptable for men in mainstream society, and may often leave you feeling shamed for not fitting more easily into a particular mold. You may even modify your life to accommodate these expectations, leaving you unhappy or unfulfilled in this lifetime. This group's message is about freedom - emotional, physical, spiritual, and societal, and presenting yourself to the world as you are, proudly and boldly.

As a group, we will strive to access deep, unconditional love for ourselves, each other, and our relationships in general. It's a complicated world, and ADAM's hope is to provide something far less complicated. So come in out of the world for a while. Unplug and experience something new, and allow it to provide something you may take into your week, and into your life.

ADAM is run on donations only for the time being, as we strive to provide something that is easy for everyone to experience. The only thing asked in return is that you bring good intentions, that you value healthy living in mind and body, and always respect your brothers. Thanks for visiting.
results.name: ADAM - A Social/Support Group For Men

results.description: Looking to engage your career? Boston's CareerEngage group focuses on career development for young professionals. We host seminars, programs, community outreach, and social networking events that cater to young professionals. CareerEngage was started with the mission of bringing together young, career minded professionals who want to become active participants in managing their own careers by partnering with peers, mentors, and career management professionals to help them achieve their career objectives.
results.name: CareerEngage-Boston

results.description: At this event we will cover: •Best practices for Cloud, DevOps and application release and deployment automation •Real customers case studies including people, process and product implications •How to justify the business case for DevOps migration including Hybrid Cloud •Demos showing how to define, wire, and automate multi-container application deployments with UrbanCode and Docker
results.name: Boston DevOps Meetup

results.description:
If you're anything like me, you have an amazing selection of cookbooks sitting nice + pretty on your shelves — yet there are volumes of recipes just waiting to be discovered + experienced. Such an undertaking must never be done alone. So I said to myself, "Why not gather new + old friends together to start a cookbook club? Better yet, create a local Meetup Group!" I invite you to join me in this culinary adventure!

Once a month, we'll dive into a chosen cookbook, prepare a variety of recipes, and get together to taste + discuss. Think of it as a gourmet potluck. Each month will feature a different cookbook (sometimes by a local author or sometimes not) and the group will meet at a different locations throughout the North Shore. All cooking levels are welcome . . . so don't be shy! Get ready to explore all sorts of new flavors while making new foodie friends.
results.name: feast :: a cookbook club

results.description:
We're a group of Queer Kinksters in Boston and beyond who know each other in person.
If you haven't been invited by someone you know in 'real life', please don't request to join this group.

If you are already a member of this group, please invite your awesome friends--defined as people you know in real life and would trust well enough to invite into your own home.
results.name: Queer Kinksters of New England

results.description: Looking to improve your bowling skills, have some fun shooting pool, or enjoy a good movie with others in the Malden and surrounding areas. Then join in, all are welcome!
results.name: Bowling, Pool, & Movie Meetup - Malden & Medford

results.description:
NeuroTechBOS is part of the NeuroTechX network. This group is to discuss about NeuroTechnology like Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCI). From medical devices to EEG consumer devices like the InteraXon's Muse, the OpenBCI board, the Emotiv's EPOC & Insight, the Neurosky's Mindwave we'll talk about 'reading' the brain. What about 'writing' the brain ? tDCS, TMS, DBS, ... Thync, Foc.us, ...

Why not talk about NeuroEthics ? Should we 'zap' our brains ? Drugs can be smart ? Can they make me smarter ?

From Hackers to Researchers we want to provide a framework that will catalyze the growth of the NeuroTech enthusiasts network. We want to raise awareness and engage with people outside these fields that have no idea what's going on in the field of neurotechnology. (If you didn't understand anything described above, but are curious, join us.)

Because each city should have it's own personal NeuroTech community and connect with other NeuroTechX nodes around the world !

--

Join the Slack discussion and play an active role in the future of DIY NeuroTech. (send a PM message to one of the organizers with your name, email and why you would like to join!)
results.name: NeuroTechBOS

results.description: This group is for the woman who is passionate about entrepreneurship. I started this group because I am in the early stages of starting a new venture and would love to connect with others who are or have started their own businesses. Let's learn and grow together as we support each other. I envision the group being small and active. Monthly breakfast/lunch/dinner check-ins, as well as us taking part in different events in the business community and planning our own. Please join if you are available to help plan and attend at least 1 event a month.

results.description:
Learn meditation, practice meditation, discuss meditation and the spiritual side of life with others.  Meditation can imperceptibly transform your life to create greater clarity and inner peace. Come regularly or on a drop-in basis.  The initial goal will be to help you turn the gaze inward and slow down the mind.  Once progress is made there, the possibilities open.  Meditations are 85% based on "Mindfulness" techniques (watching the breath, tuning into the body) and 15% working with subtle energy.

We meet every Monday night at 7:30pm near the JP/Mission Hill line.  Location given when you confirm a meetup.   We are 7 min from the Orange line and there is on-street parking.  A $1-2 donation is recommended. 

Open to Everyone - GLBT (etc.) and S !
results.name: JP / MH (Boston) Meditation Group

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in learning more about Financial Planning, specifically: Investment & tax planning, Retirement planning, Insurance planning, and Small Business strategies. We also like to bring added value to our centers of influence by doing presentations on a variety of different Business Development features (ie. Smartphones & iPads, Social Media: LI, Twitter, FB, etc), Google + & SEO, etc. About us: We are Balance Wealth Advisors, a financial advisory practice of Ameriprise Financial located in Wellesley and Fall River, MA. We are very excited to offer this group to the general public and prospects as a way to bring in referrals not just for ourselves, but also all the members. Right now we have about 80 members not on Meetup and we are looking to increase our #s! Our group offers unique monthly interactive events and presentations that range from the above financial topics to health, to how to better your own business. By providing broader lessons and communicating something meaningful to our COIs (centers of Influence) we are able to provide an added benefit to all members. This eventually generates a buzz and gets people talking. It is important to do the basics the right way and deliver!
results.name: Financial Planning & Professional Networking Meetup

results.description: Wine Education and Tasting in Boston. Objective wine tasting, discussion and social without the sales.
results.name: Wine Tasting Boston- American Wine Society Chapter

results.description:
As the founder of Silicon Valley Startup Entrepreneurs, we share your vision of creating a space to meet, dream, learn, strategize and co-create. Yes, we are fully on board that dreaming is still part of the creation process! Silicon Valley Startup Entrepreneurs began with a vision to provide startup founders access--access to educational and other information that every first time founder should know or be exposed to. This includes access to high caliber angels, VCs and “been there done that” successful, serial entrepreneurs. 

The Silicon Valley ecosystem is unique, and, that’s why we created a new meetup group “Access Silicon Valley” that extends beyond the geographical borders of Silicon Valley! In fact it’s much more than just a Meetup group…it’s the opportunity to become part of the Silicon Valley ecosystem or “mindshare” as we like to think of it. Access Silicon Valley is the “virtual bridge” to Silicon Valley, where startup entrepreneurs and serial entrepreneurs in real time, get access to and interact with, angels, VCs and great entrepreneurs that they otherwise wouldn’t get the opportunity to see, hear or possibly connect with. 

In addition we have put together valuable workshops to prepare startup entrepreneurs for the roller coaster ride of the startup world!! We encourage you to join us. Access Silicon Valley is an extension of the overall global vision to build “virtual bridges” between those cities that have great startup communities and Silicon Valley. Stay tuned for an exciting journey as we deliver events and workshops that you won’t want to miss!! We invite you to reach out and learn more about our amazing network of VC’s, entrepreneurs, artists, technologists and designers, as we want YOU to be part of the journey!!
results.name: Access Silicon Valley (Boston)

results.description: Recently, I have become interested in the Tao Te Ching and It is becoming a great inspiration in my life. I was wondering if there were people out there in our community who like share what they know about the Tao. The group will also welcome friends who like to participate and learn along with us.
results.name: The way of the Tao

results.description: Sales and Marketing Innovators (SAMI) is a professional organization made up of seasoned marketing and sales professionals who take calculated risks and know that innovation and execution ultimately drive competitive and personal success. We Strive to bring members new ways to innovate for measurable results through interactive, peer-sharing events and content that focuses on ways to drive efficiency, effectiveness, market share, mind share and wallet share.

Hi ladies,

I am a 29 year old lady from Boston who has moved here with my husband. I am a Montessori teacher who is particularly interested in Special Education. I am looking to meet some new female friends for a coffee, walks in the park, lunch, jogs and general chit chat.
results.name: Boston Ladies Society of Chit Chat

results.description: This group started through Bentley's Business Analytics graduate program and is for people who love having fun with smart people. We are unicorns because we are the rare breed that love data analysis, but also have strong interpersonal skills. You'll also have access to our, coming-soon, YouTube channel where you will be able to learn how to cook, to tell when a food is ripe or bad, what fruits/veggies can be grown in Massachusetts and even how to get started with your own fruit/veggie garden.

Some books our group has chosen to read in the past: 

• Americanah by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie 

• Revolutionary Road by Richard Yates 

• The Goldfinch by Donna Tartt 

• A Confederacy of Dunces by John Kennedy Toole 

• All the Light We Cannot See by Anthony Doerr 

• Station Eleven by Emily St. John Mandel 

• The Miniaturist by Jesse Burton 

• The Invention of Wings by Sue Monk Kidd
