results.description:
Boskone is a regional SF convention run by NESFA. Boskone is held at the Westin Waterfront Hotel in Boston (right next door to the BCEC) every February.
Boskone's attendees come from all over the world, and are comprised of editors, authors, artists, gamers, and filkers.
Boskone offers the following attractions:
A consuite to end all consuites, you never know who you're going to run into while grabbing a soda or a cookie. Could be your favorite author or artist.
A world class art show featuring the best science fiction, fantasy, and horror art from all over the world.
KKs, otherwise known as KaffeeKlashes, where you can sit down with an author and discuss a book or other things. Please note that you do have to sign up for these and there may be a cost.
Autograph sessions with some of the authors.
A dealer's room featuring books, jewelry, figurines, t-shirts, and more.
An anime/film room featuring some old favorites as well as some movies so horrible you can't help but laugh.
A game room to satisfy all. The library of games will look familiar to you if you attended Arisia. They're from the same club. The video games at Boskone are located in the game room, and Boskone features a PS3, 360, Wii, Gamecube, Sega Genesis, and an Atari 2600 (you get an award if you can pry Bill away from River Raid ^_^).
www.nesfa.org/boskone for more details or www.nesfa.org to find out more about the club running it.
results.name: Boskone

results.description:
This group is for people who are interested in drug law reform in Massachusetts and that means legalization of cannabis for adults, as well as all other major recreational drugs. This is for those who believe in ending the New Jim Crow.  

This is also a group dedicated to statistical based arguments rather than hyperbole or sensationalism.

Yes, heroin and methamphetamine are dangerous and very addictive drugs, but the drug war against them and other drugs cause way more social harms than the drugs themselves. We can look to progressive cities, states, countries such as Vancouver B.C., Colorado, Washington, and Portugal for inspiration. Decriminalization of cannabis and even cocaine and heroin is not enough as that leaves the black market in place which still allows for unrestricted access to minors, predatory drug sales, violence, reduced but still continued mass incarceration of minorities (due to racial profiling and imprisonment of disadvantaged minorities who join the drug game but get caught at a higher rate than their peers who are not minorities), animosity towards police in urban communities, ruined lives due to childhood errors in judgement and lack of opportunity (due to a criminal record for those youth who sell drugs and are caught), etc.

We will start by organizing activities to gather signatures for the 4 ballot initiatives to legalize recreational marijuana as well as to register citizens to vote at various locations throughout Massachusetts (signature collection and voter registration tables at grocery stores, at concerts, etc.). I need help from those who are like minded and who are interested in voter registration and drug policy reform and activism.

If you are new to this topic, books to consider reading would be The New Jim Crow by Michelle Alexander, High Price: A Neuroscientist's Journey of Self-Discovery That Challenges Everything You Know About Drugs and Society by Carl Hart, Our Right To Drugs: The Case for a Free Market Paperback by Thomas Szasz, Chasing the Scream: The First and Last Days of the War on Drugs Hardcover by Johann Hari, Saying Yes by Jacob Sullum, and http://www.npr.org/2015/09/14/440327585/ta-nehisi-coates-outlines-path-to-mass-incarceration-in-the-atlantic

Another idea would be to have some book club meetings to read some of the above books as well as others that are of interest to the members of this meetup. This is not so much a social group as a group that is dedicated to actual action.

Let's start with reform around cannabis and after that is achieved let's start advocating for change around other drugs.  Too many people are losing friends and family to prison and to drug overdose in our state.
results.name: Working to end the New Jim Crow in Massachusetts

results.description:
Each time we get together, we'll enjoy the collective energy of guided group meditations, and you'll experience how simple,delightful and easy it can be. There will also be time for sharing, discussion and journaling after each meditation to deepen your experience and learning, and to socialize at the end. You're encouraged to bring a journal or notebook and pen.

We practice meditation not to get better at meditating; rather, to get better at living with greater inner peace, love, ease and joy. We meditate to connect to our best and highest self and all the inner resources and wisdom available to us, and, of course, to experience the deeply relaxed, pleasurable states that arise with it.

One of our participants said that my guided meditations and our discussions are like "therapy for the soul".  I thought that was so cool a way to describe it!  Actually, tho', it's the connecting to your soul/spirit-self that is therapeutic for your mind and body.  You get the point, tho'.  :-) 

You can bring your own spirituality to your meditations. The paradigm I offer through the meditations and our discussions is based on the premise that we are all one energy and non-physical Spirit consciousness in individual physical forms and personalities, here to create and expand from those uniquely created human desires. Therefore, from this source energy/Spirit, we have the ability to easily and joyfully create the life and experiences we desire.

I also believe it’s time for us to awaken to the fullness of who we are as Spiritual beings, to evolve, and to become more and more competent with our innate abilities for creating what we really want: peace, harmony, joy, happiness, fulfillment, love, abundance, freedom, etc. I believe we are here to live a happy, harmonious and successful life.

Each time we gather, we'll have a different theme to help you live with less stress and anxiety, and to build and reinforce positive thinking patterns, beliefs and inner narratives that will support you in living with greater inner peace, love, ease and joy.

Typically, we'll have 2-3 guided meditations, with discussion and instruction in between to help you carry the positive feelings and lessons experienced into your day and life, and to connect deeply with each other in these meaningful ways.

This is a perfect time to let go of stress and "busy-ness", and to fully let go and relax into bliss. Regardless of the intentions you arrive with, they always seem to be magically satisfied.

I would love to have a strong community; so I hope you'll participate regularly and stay in touch by participating in our community's message board discussions and receiving my e-mails . To be able to do so, go to your account, and under "Your Groups", each one has an "Edit email settings". Set your preferences there to receive my e-mails. Hope to hear from you, and to see you soon!
results.name: Metrowest Meditation Made Easy Meetup

results.description:
Hi, Thanks for stopping by.

This is a group for people wanting to have amazing success doing the online dating thing... and might need a little bit if help to get there.  All meetups will have a social aspect to it too and there will be purely social events as well. 

Top dating coaches and other relevant professionals in the Boston area will be invited to share their expertise to make it all work great ...and easy ... for you. Dating is supposed to be fun you know :)

There will be workshops from experts in their fields helping you with things like:

How do you go about doing it all and adjust your mindset so that you are actually having an amazing time and it is not just an annoying, time consuming thing that you just "have to do" to find a match.

What are effective photos and how do you get them. And what do you do if you "think" that you're not photogenic? There will even be photo parties to help get some awesome fun candids for your profile. Actual parties, but with professional photographers present to "catch you" having a great time.

How do you compose the words of your profile so that it actually catches someone's eye and entices them to respond? Does your profile "name" matter? What is a good one for you? How to you say say hi to someone so that he or she actually responds.  

There's just a small sample of the topics we will cover. This is a new meetup group and it is here to serve you in your online dating adventure. So let us know what you need. 

The meetups will mostly be in my photography studio in a pretty cool loft space in Waltham in a historic mill building.

Hopefully see you soon!

Jon
results.name: Boston Dating Success: Online and In Person

topics.name: Stop Renting and Buy Your Own Home

results.description:
Tired of paying rent with nothing to show for it?  Our group is dedicated to educating renters on how to lease-to-own a home in Middlesex or Essex County Massachusetts. We invite those looking for a way to turn their rent into an opportunity to buy and also home sellers looking to sell their homes by non-traditional means.  

Most people do not realize the different options available when it comes to buying or selling a home. Just because the bank says no does not mean you can't achieve your goal of home ownership.  Your job is your credit. While mortgage guidelines are more strict than ever there are still ways you can own a beautiful home, in a great neighborhood with great schools that your children will love!

Our group will educate members about lease-to-own and bring renters and home sellers together for networking.  We also plan to have speakers talk about credit repair and other topics.

We look forward to helping all of our members reach their goals!
results.name: Middlesex County Lease to Own Meetup

results.description: Gerais means “general” in Portuguese. This name was chosen to signify that Capoeira is for everyone–all ages, all physical abilities, all ethnic and social backgrounds. Through Capoeira’s unique history of discrimination and freedom, we seek to promote diversity, tolerance and self-expression. Capoeira combines martial arts, dance, music, and rich cultural traditions, resulting in a physically gratifying and emotionally satisfying experience. We believe that personal growth and fulfillment is the foundation for a better society. And that, in essence, is the philosophy behind our name.
results.name: Capoeira Gerais Boston

results.description:
Hello,

We're a group of people aged 50 and over based in the Metro West area who like to meet up for great conversation and critical thinking. We meet up at different coffee shops and restaurants across the suburbs.  

This group would be perfect for intellectually curious adults, especially those who would like to meet for brunch, coffee, or dinner in a relaxed atmosphere with stimulating conversation. Come share your perspective about life, including what you have learned and what puzzles you at the present moment.  

Discussing ideas, current events, the arts, healthy living, philosophy, sociology and literature may open the door to a relationship for a lifetime .  I believe everyone has something interesting to say when asked the right questions!   

Welcome to Coffee and Tea 2.0.

Chris


*Coffee and Tea does not accept financial contributions.  

*  I am a huge fan  of  Alain de Botton,  a Swiss-born, British-based philosopher and  writer. He is the founder of the The School Of Life, The Book of Life and creative director of Living Architecture.

"It’s too easy to assume that what makes us likable are our strengths, our accomplishments, the things we’re proud of. Certainly this impresses, but it isn’t what draws others to us."

"It’s deeply poignant that we should expend so much effort on trying to look strong before the world – when, all the while, it’s really only ever the revelation of the somewhat embarrassing, sad, melancholy and anxious bits of us that are what makes us endearing to others, and can transform strangers into friends."

Alain de Botton.



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MPR3o6Hnf2g
results.name: COFFEE AND TEA 2.0

results.description:
Calling all orchestral, chamber, and early music instrumentalists and singers who also love the outdoors!

The Mountains and Music committee of the Appalachian Mountain Club's Boston Chapter sponsors two weekends each year that combine music-making and outdoor activities. The fall weekend is at Pinkham Notch, NH. The winter weekend alternates between Pinkham Notch and Sargent Camp in Peterborough, NH.  We sponsor at least one chamber music play-in day per year. Signups happen here and also at our AMC website (http://amcboston.org/committee/music) and our Facebook page (AMC Mountains and Music).

For the weekends, instrumentalists join together to play chamber and early music as well as to rehearse and perform several orchestral pieces. We welcome any orchestral instrument - strings, brass, woodwinds, timpani, etc. - and early instruments, such as recorder. Instrumentalists should be able to sight-read. Singers rehearse, then perform, a large choral work with the orchestra and form informal groups to sing madrigals, rounds, and other small ensemble pieces. During the winter weekend, there is a third-day option that includes a talent show on the final night, where you can showcase any special skill, whether musical, poetic, juggling, or whatever. Listeners, usually spouses, are always welcome to our weekends. Weekends are enjoyed by from 80 - 120 attendees.

Our one-day play-in is usually in March and most recently is being held in Newton, MA. We help attending musicians form compatible groups for four 45-minute playing sessions. Our play-ins range in size from 40 - 70 musicians. The play-ins are not appropriate for listeners... please join us for our weekends, instead.

Come join the fun!
results.name: AMC-Boston Chapter: Mountains & Music Committee

results.description:
Welcome to the Krosslink program @ Southborough MA Public Library. 

Krosslink.org is a volunteer-driven community program created to help develop, nurture, and foster entrepreneurship by connecting aspiring entrepreneurs to local business leaders, mentors and civic leaders who can help them achieve their goals. The program creates a unique link with local libraries that empowers them to evolve their mission into “Entrepreneur Greenhouses”. The result is a vibrant eco-system where individuals looking to build a business can find resources and activities to kick start their plans such as networking events with other business leaders, a collaborative workspace filled with keynote speakers, bar-stool pitch sessions, facilitated meet-up sessions and mentoring by SCORE business experts. For more details on how you can leverage this ecosystem to develop your business, please visit us at www.krosslink.org

results.description:
OSHO Boston Meditation group meets as often as noted on the monthly schedule. The meditations begin promptly at the indicated time, so please be aware that if you are late, you will not be permitted to enter the meditation space. 

About Osho

Osho's unique contribution to the understanding of who we are defies categorization. Mystic and a scientist, a rebellious spirit whose sole interest is to alert humanity to the urgent need to discover a new way of living. About his own work Osho has said that he is helping to create the conditions for the birth of a new kind of human being. He often characterizes this new human being as "Zorba the Buddha" - capable of enjoying the earthly pleasures of a Zorba the Greek and the silent serenity of Gautama the Buddha.

 OSHO® Active Meditations

Osho is known for his revolutionary contribution to the science of inner transformation, with an approach to meditation that acknowledges the accelerated pace of contemporary life. His unique OSHO Active Meditations™  are designed to first release the accumulated stresses of body and mind, so that it is then easier to take an experience of stillness and thought-free relaxation into daily life. 

To find out more about Osho

For more information about Osho and his work, you may visit www.osho.com. This is the official OSHO® website, where you can buy books, CDs or find out more about the meditation centre in Pune if you would like a deeper experience of OSHO® meditations. 


OSHO is a registered trademark of Osho International Foundation, used with permission,www.osho.com/trademarks.  

Some material used here (images and text excerpts) is Copyright © OSHO International Foundation, www.osho.com/copyright
results.name: Boston OSHO® Active Meditation Group

The purpose of this meetup is to foster connection between like-minded people who are interested in spirituality, personal growth, and who believe they're here to leave the world better than they found it, even in small ways.

All who resonate with the mission and the purpose of the group are welcome.  I launched a similar group a few years ago in New York, and I'm hoping that in addition to social meet-and-greet events, that we'll be able to find space and hold **affordable** meditations, workshops taught by group members, and so on.  The goals are to meet like-minded people, learn from each other, and foster enriching connections with compassionate, spiritual people.

results.description:
This is a group for any adult interested in having meaningful conversations with people in a casual environment and discussing broad life topics that might have impact on our emotions, values, perspectives, relationships, etc.  In order to keep an active status in the group, members are required to attend at least one meetup every six months, and have no more than two no-shows in 12 months. 

There will be stimuli for each meeting to inspire the conversation. The stimuli can be anything, such as a picture, a short story, a breaking news, etc. Each meeting includes member and stimuli introduction, small team and whole group discussion. 

Every attendee is required to raise 1-3 questions inspired by the stimuli. We will discuss why these questions are important; how these questions relate to one's personal life experience; what is one's perspectives on these questions, and how the discussion might affect one's future thinking. 

This is a place to share our souls and learn from others. This is not a place to promote any particular school of thoughts, beliefs, faiths, political views, etc. We must keep an open mind, respect each other, and agree to disagree. 

We meet monthly on the fourth Sunday nights 6:30pm-8:30pm in the Panera Bread at 1241 Centre St, Newton, MA 02459 Phone:(617) 559-9850. This location is just a few minutes walk from the Newton Center T station. Behind the cafe, there are plenty of meter parking spaces, which are free all day on Sundays or after 6pm on any other days.

results.description:
What is StartupBlink?

StartupBlink is an interactive global startup ecosystem map featuring tens of thousands of listed entities, including new startups, coworking spaces and accelerators. Add yours as well! http://StartupBlink.com

StartupBlink hosts 100 meetup groups in cities all over the world, and Boston is one of them!

Why should you join this Meetup?

Do you want to find co-founders or partners? Meet like-minded people? Grow your business faster? Learn how to hire smarter?  

Then come to your city's next StartupBlink meetup!

Meetups are for startup founders, coworking and accelerator staff members, or anyone who works in the local startup community. We love to have new members in our networking and special events!

Who organizes the events?

The events are organized by the local startup community (that means you!). Our networking events happen in the last week of each month, but additional events are welcomed as well, so please let us know if you want to organize a meetup and we will post it. All meetups are hosted in accordance with the terms of use posted on www.StartupBlink.com

What can you expect from our meetups?

Firstly, our meetup events are all about networking. You can expect to meet like-minded entrepreneurs and create the contacts that will help you grow your project.

You and your fellow group members can decide on how to use your local meetup to your advantage. You can have general discussions or specific presentations and lectures. We welcome you to attend your local meetup and get in touch with us directly to share suggestions and ideas.
results.name: StartupBlink Boston

results.description: Calling all country music lovers, country dancers or wanna be country dancers!  There are a BUNCH of people that like country music in MA. results.description:
We are about ideation and startup creation. If you are self-motivated and intelligent, this meetup was created with you in mind.

I've been involved in the startup community for a little while, and I've begun to realize a few things.  The motif seems to be about learning how to exchange your manager for a VC, in the hope that those with good ideas haven't been completely disillusioned by a risk-averse world.  We're about something a little different: learning to think for yourself, and plotting your course through the difficult world of business.

This is a community of independent thinkers, and provides a space to share resources and safely express ideas. Our events are pitch environments, round-table discussions, and presentations where members can express their ideas in confidence and receive feedback from multiple disciplines; the goal being to bring forth latent desires and create opportunity.

If your idea may need patent, talk to an organizer before presenting to the general body(I'm available for coffee, by appointment).  There are several rules to intellectual property, and we're here to help you navigate that complexity.

Our goal is not to find you a job, but to teach you how to market yourself with the best tools available. Change is difficult, and we often face resistance to even minor upsets: we’re here to help you through and guide the world to become all that it can be.
results.name: Boston Startup Ideation Community

results.description:
New England FIG is for all programmers either interested in or experienced with the Forth programming language. We want to build a community of Forthers in the New England area that can share knowledge, projects, nifty ideas and experience, and to generally foster and encourage the practice of fine-grained, interactive, minimalist, low-fat computing. These are to be not unlike the SV-FIG, Forth-Gesellschaft groups -- presentations, demos, tutorials and discussions about your projects or things you've seen and heard about! If you have a topic (big or small) send me an email ( andreas.wagner@lowfatcomputing.org ) and I'll add it to the agenda -- DON'T hesitate.

Why Forth?

• Forth is one of the few environments that is totally comprehensible by one person.

• Forth has no inherent fixed syntax -- programming is done by extending the language to your application. Thus, it can become what ever you need it to be.

• Forth has a "low floor; high ceiling" approach to abstraction -- that is, it can be both low level, high level and anywhere in-between.

• You can get an application to run in a minuscule amount of flash or RAM.

• Forth is likely the most compact way to represent software.

• You can try things out interactively in real time as you build your system.

• The compiling functionality is an exposed part of the language like everything else.
results.name: New England Forth Interest Group (NEFIG)

results.description:
Welcome! The Mother Connection is a fee-based non-profit organization for mothers and families in the Merrimack Valley.  Membership dues are $35 for one year, $60 for two years, or $75 for three years. If you would like to become a member of TMC, please go to our website www.themotherconnection.org


Welcome to The Mother Connection (TMC), a fun, supportive, and educational community organization for mothers and families in the Merrimack Valley area of Massachusetts.

The Mother Connection was created 33 years ago by a group of 11 women who recognized the lack of support for mothers of young children in the community. Through their innovation and hard work, the organization has been able to provide its members with educational resources, a valuable Newsletter, Workshops, Adventures, Children's Parties, Special Interest and Support Groups, and much more. As TMC has grown over the years to serve more than 350 families, we continue to work hard to help all mothers in various times of need. In addition to supporting our members, we give to the local community through a variety of fund-raising efforts.

TMC was created not only to provide resources and fun things for mothers to do with their children, but to serve as a venue for mothers to share and build their skills by volunteering to help maintain this growing organization. TMC is entirely volunteer based. It's about both giving and giving back to our community. We want everyone to enjoy the benefits of being a member, and to also contribute in any way they can. There is always an opportunity to volunteer and share your skills and experience with TMC.
results.name: The Mother Connection

results.description:
Guitar Lab is a small group guitar class meant for adult students.

DEAR FRIENDS! WE ARE ON A BREAK FOR NOW. Two reasons: first I'll be traveling for a bit and even though David is staying here, but... It looks like we don't have too many students who show up. Basically we have to cancel very often because no one comes. So we've decided to give it a bit of time and see what to do with it.
Please check back with us mid April. In a mean time, David and me will continue to give private lessons.
Here is my email: anastasiyadumma@gmail.com Please, always feel free to email me with any questions.

I will also have to step down to basic membership on meetup website so they don't charge me. So some of you might see "pending membership" or something like this. Please don't get it wrong, we love you and do not want to exclude anybody, but... Paying this little fee is kind a feels weird at the moment since we are going on the break.


Usually we get quite a few beginners, so if you are just starting don't be shy, you definitely can join us. If you have been playing for some time I am sure you will find a lot of new and helpful ideas as well. If the level will be very different then we might divide it to two groups eventually.

Half of the class time is dedicated to a consecutive curriculum. I try to choose themes that are relevant to everybody in the class. We might talk about some aspects of technique, or reading, or theory etc. The other half of the class time I usually help students with their individual questions.

I see this class as a supportive and motivational environment for your self-teaching process.

This is PAY-WHAT-YOU-WANT class. We kindly ask you to support your teachers and Westland Guitars that provided the space.

There are two professional guitar teachers for you: David and Anastasiya. We lead the class together. Usually we divide the group into two sections in order to address more precisely students' needs.

Let me say couple words about us. We both graduated from Berklee College of Music, both are playing guitar for a while while. We both have a lot of experience teaching, yet every class still feels very fresh and new! )

We really enjoy teaching these groups classes a lot! Being able to help people is really a joy. Every time this class gives us so much energy and inspiration we hope it will do the same for you!

Contact:
Anastasiya Dumma
anastasiyadumma@gmail.com

results.description: Find Local Singles Near You, You've probably heard that long distance relationships seldom work. When you give this a try, you'll be able to meet quality local singles that live near you. Why waste time with dead end relationships when you will feel far better connecting with someone special you can actually see face-to-face? According to recent studies, Americans are marrying later. In fact, as of 2014, single people in the United States outnumber the married,1 meaning that if you are currently single, you’re in good company! One reason for this could be that the demands of modern life don’t leave much time to look for love: with the typical US work week now at 47 hours or more,2 singles who want to get a toe on the professional ladder are finding their leisure time is at a premium. Of course, just because increasing numbers who are finding themselves single, it doesn’t mean that they wish to stay that way. DJ Chris Fiores Singles Dance Party is an enjoyable, relaxing and social way to meet hundreds of professional local singles. Join Us this and every Friday Night at Angelica's 49 S Main St, Middleton, MA. Never a cover charge. Plenty of free parking. Dine, Dance, Mix, Mingle and Meet Someone New And Exciting. Indeed, many are finding that the best solution to the work/life dilemma is to seek a compromise: it’s not about trying to ignore the desire for love, instead it is a matter of getting smarter about finding it.

Business Network International (BNI) has been around for decades helping businesses to grow and members to profit. It is based on the premise that "Givers Gain" and with all the growth in the area lately, this is exactly why we are starting a chapter right here in South Boston. Our eight week kick-off pre-launch is in progress now!

The best part about BNI is the fact that there is no competition since only one member from each profession will be accepted. This makes it much easier for everyone to get to know each other and establish the comfort level that enables them to give out referrals. Currently, we are in the "pre-core process" where we invite members from all professions, interested in securing a non-competitive seat in the group, to meet, learn more about the process and submit applications.

We meet every Tuesday morning at 380 West Broadway, at the new home of Fairway Mortgage. They have a great new conference room that will hold up to 50 people. The group will ultimately have members representing many different professions including a Real Estate Broker, Financial Planner, Long Term Care Professional, Attorney (broken up into practice type), Information Technology Consultant, Mortgage Broker, Insurance Professional, General Contractor, Plumber, Real Estate Closing Attorney, Photographer, etc. - the list goes on and on.

If you are a part of a small and medium business in the South Boston or Greater Boston Area and want to establish a relationship with a group of professionals that will refer you business with no competition, then this is the place for you!

results.description:
Welcome to Boston Munch - Fetish/Kink/BDSM for Newbies and Novices

Mission Statement:
Exploring kink is a very personal and emotional process. Sometimes you just need time to work things through. Having a community of people to help can make a big difference too. I hope you will join and come out to meet us soon but if now is not the right time for you kink will always be here just as it always has and just as it always will. So if the right time does come about soon we look forward to welcoming you to our small and supportive community. The right community can make all the difference in the world and that's what we hope for all who decide to join.

The Newbie Primer

If you are new to kink and nervous its absolutely normal. It can be one of the strongest emotional decisions you make in your life! Fortunately theres is a silver lining there- We were all in your shoes at the beginning and we promise it gets easier (and fun and kinkier) over time. And its definitely worth it. Bottom line though: if you don't tell us how you feel we can't help you! We want to be here for you! Reach Out! Send a member a message and we will work with you to make things right.

The goal of kink is to help people feel confident in their ability to seek out and achieve sexual pleasure. There are few institutions in the world geared towards helping people with that. In open society sex is not allowed. But the reality is we all need grounding in this. If you join our group we promise to do everything we can to help you achieve that.

Kink is about lots of things but ultimately there is one thing that takes precedence above all else- you! What is a Munch?

A munch is a social gathering for people interested in kink (kinksters) and the BDSM community. Come learn about this alternative expression of sexuality in a safe and supportive environment.

Read more about what a munch is by clicking here

Values

Our goal is to be as open and welcome as possible to kinksters including everyone from the brand-spanking new (pun-intended) to the experienced and wise. Come learn and explore in a community of like-minded folks. Kink can be explored on one's own but it takes a community to grow and understand it in the fullest best way possible.

Privacy and Exclusivity vs. Inclusivity

Privacy is very important to us so the group is kept up to only include active members. That's why the enrollment is so small! But we promise that every member is an active member. Basically what that means is you are free to join but if you don't RSVP or return our check-in messages you will be booted. Kink will always be here and so will we. Sometimes its just not the right time to start something new and we totally get that! For that reason and many others everyone is free to rejoin at anytime.

follow us on facebook - Boston Munch
results.name: (Active) Boston Munch - Fetish Kink BDSM Poly

This is an offshoot of the Half-Persian Facebook group and Half-Persian London Meetup group.

The Half Persian group was started after some comments from other half-Persians in London wanting to meet up to share experiences, plan activities, go out, etc.

Backdrop ----------- Do you have one Persian parent and one non-Persian parent? Then this group is especially for you! In Farsi, the term "do-rageh" literally translates as "two-veined," meaning two kinds of blood in one vein, but used to describe mixed Persians. Although our dual-ethnicity existence may be a bit difficult at times, having the best of both worlds is a sweet life and one that we're proud to represent!

The events varies from trying out new restaurants, sports activities, Persian calendar events (nourouz, Shabe Yalda etc)

It's a way to meet fellow Halfies/Hybrids and create a tight support group who can act as an extension to our family and friends.  Whether it's professional networking, new in town or sharing a good spot you find with fellow hybrids.

results.description:
This Meetup is an extension of the website https://www.Stitch.net, and is run by Stitch.net’s team. This Meetup group provides adults 50+ with the opportunities to meet and mingle with others from the greater Boston Area during casual and extremely low-pressure events. Some events we have put on in the past are “Speed-Meeting” events, movie screenings, coffee get-togethers, and more. We welcome anyone 50+, who is looking for any type of companionship, to join, and strongly encourage future Meetup suggestions and ideas! 

What is Stitch.net?
Stitch.net is an online community, which helps adults 50 years and over find the companionship they are looking for. For some people this might be a romantic partner, for others it could be just a friend who likes partaking in the same activities. Stitch recognizes that there are many different types of companionship, and that the need for companionship doesn’t go away as we get older. 

 Please Note:
-People attending these meetups may just be members on Stitch.net, and not a member of this Meetup group. -Even though we highly recommend it, you will never be required or pressured to join Stitch.net’s online services, and will never be required to be on Stitch.net to attend an event posted in this Meetup group.  

-Some of the RSVPs for our events will be done through a different website other than Meetup when we have to limit the number of attendees. Due to all of Stitch.net’s members not being on Meetup, we believe this is the most fair way to RSVP for these types of events. We will always post on the Meetup when this is the case.  

Questions? Comments?
Email Michael at michaeldean@stitch.net
(415) 800-2918 x702
results.name: Stitch Greater Boston - Adults 50+ Looking for Companions

results.description: This weekly (and sometimes more) game is hosted by local club, Upsetters FC. We are looking for folks interested in playing technical, small-sided games that we hold in Dorchester/Boston. We play year round. During winter, we play futsal indoors. During warmer months, we play small-sided games outdoors, ranging from street/court surfaces to small-sided turf pitches. We've started this group because we'd like to have more people join the regular games that we host, and we hope to meet some folks that will "get" the club and might be interested in staying involved (no pressure though). In general, our games prioritize skill, strategy, and team play over physical brutality and aggression. Indoors, we typically play 4 v 4 with small goals, no keepers, and an official futsal ball on a basketball court. Outdoors, we most often play 4 v 4 (or 5 v 5) on a small-sided turf field with a size 5 ball; sometimes we also will play a street game on a street hockey rink with a street/futsal ball. ABOUT UPSETTERS FC: We are a diverse club based in Dorchester, focused on technical, small-sided games. We are a real club, with a family feel, an interest in design and community, and an appreciation for reggae music. We hold several regular club events (tournaments, parties, trips, etc.) and try and keep things interesting by playing friendlies with like-minded clubs. Sometimes we play in leagues, but often we find we enjoy playing and training together more than league play (and we've been successful in leagues). The focus of our sessions is overwhelmingly on "open" play, but we sometimes integrate games that feature a tactical/team component. Our vibe is laid back and friendly, but we appreciate a good game, particularly one that flows well and features lots of movement of the ball and players. We have good players, and are looking for more, but more so we are looking for good people who will appreciate our weekly game and our club. We like dope uniforms and gear. Men and women are welcome; this probably isn't the best environment for real novices, but we welcome those "returning" to the game and those that have recently fallen in love with it. We don't tolerate ultra-competitive BS and those that mess up the vibe we've worked hard to create over the years.
results.name: Dorchester Small-Sided Soccer & Futsal

Our events empower entrepreneurs by connecting people and creating opportunities for companies to develop new businesses, meet customers, launch new products, promote their brands and expand their markets.

BOIS strives to help: Entrepreneurs, Students, Techies, Startups, Investors, Mentors and Advisors.

This group will: Host great events, get you involved, connect people and help you take action.

Join, Participate and Enjoy! ☺

Home to some of USA's hottest startups, Boston is an emerging force in the world of innovation. The purpose of this group is to bring together members of the local and international community to support and foster the growth of a thriving startup hub. Let's see how we can collaborate now and in the future to create, sustain and enable new and greater startups.

We are glad to have you on board and look forward to meeting you at one of our frequent events.

Sincerely, 

Jeff Robinson & the BOIS Team

P.S. You can find all our Meetups here: Global Internet Startups. Check us out when you're traveling or if you ever move abroad!

topics.name: Pursuing an Education in Information Technology

results.description:
Information Technologists are amazing people with a wide range of abilities, some competencies are utilized in the workplace and some are not. People who have less experience in IT can benefit from the knowledge of technologists because they are finding challenges with the support they need. Technologists can benefit from meeting with people outside of the workplace so they can share their knowledge and converse without having to take their work home, impress someone or delve deeply into what makes them tick. Bringing them together to meet and learn from each other is the purpose of this group.

My experience is broad and multivariate. I've had numerous opportunities to provide emotional support to others while, engaging them with my knowledge of computers and technology, providing them with a means to advance their careers while, providing me with the opportunity to be creative. This group represents an opportunity for me to engineer a space where technologists can bring together their knowledge with others as I have while, connecting and becoming more creative themselves.

My plan is to have meetings every other week in a casual coffee shop environment where people feel comfortable speaking openly about subjects of their interest which may or may not be highly technical. In some respects this group is experimental but in others I may find a way to structure conversations with certain rules so the experience is more practical and less free-form. I am a professionally trained facilitator with a diverse background in engineering beginning with undergraduate and graduate work and extending into vocations that include instruction and innovation. I'm very excited about this group and I think you will find it a rewarding experience as well, so please join us!

results.description:
This is a group for those who think democracy should more accessible through the internet, and are interested in pushing for a decentralized Blockchain voting system in Boston, and its surrounding territories. 

Don’t make the mistake of thinking that progress is inevitable and that someone smarter or more capable than you is already working on it. The truth is that the future is dependent on the actions of individuals. Progress really happens when smart people get together, and work hard to solve the right problems, in the right way, at the right time. Let's get together and make this happen!

This group's goal is to organize around things like creating media, like infographics and videos to explain the concept in plain and persuasive terms, engaging and involving the public in a dialogue about our mission through events, petitions, and canvassing, reaching out to media such as blogs, podcasts, and general news, and conducting talks in relevant forums.

The final goal is to build up a clear vision, and bring the idea to the Government, to be used in elections and referendums. I encourage each of you to join me in constructing a more free, and transparent future.
results.name: The Boston Blockchain Voting Group

results.description:
This group is for all those out there who are songwriters, whether you are a beginner or a professional. This group meets every other week. We begin the group by introducing ourselves and everyone brings in a song or two that they are working on or have worked on. Each person can give constructive criticism to that person's work that is sharing his or her song. We ask that each person brings 5 copies of their lyrics. There is a guitar and keyboard available for you to perform your song. You are welcome to bring your own instrument. If you don't play an instrument and just write lyrics that is fine too or if you don't write lyrics and just write instrumentals that is also fine. Whatever you bring that you can contribute is OK! The setting is in a library room so music will have to be unplugged at this time.

*Membership Dues* 

Everyone can sign up for free and I ask that everyone pay $5 annually after their first meet-up if you will be attending more meet-ups.  You can pay this directly to me at the meet-up.

This fee covers the cost of the meetup site.

I would like to create a local group that includes everyone. I would like to setup different events for us to do. Some suggestions could be going for walks at the Arnold Arboretum or Jamaica Pond. Meeting up for dinner one or two nights a week and trying different restaurants (Bukhara, Acapulcos, city feed) and others that are here. We could also maybe meet up once a week for trivia night at one of the bars or try a different bar once a week. As the group gets to know each other we could do pot luck dinners, movie nights and whatever else we fancy. We can even play tennis or shoot hoops. results.description: This meetup group is the Boston chapter of Medicine X (http://medicinex.stanford.edu). Medicine X is a catalyst for new ideas about the future of medicine and health care. The initiative explores how emerging technologies will advance the practice of medicine, improve health, and empower patients to be active participants in their own care. Such emerging technologies include those that are: largely digital (e.g., online peer-to-peer healthcare communities, wearables); • methodological (e.g., human-centered design and innovation, service design); • cultural (e.g., participatory medicine, doctors and patients functioning as designers); • and more. This group is intended to bring together (e)patients, healthcare providers, experience designers, technologists, and researchers. The group will offer opportunities to hear from key members of these communities, experience emerging technologies, collaborate on projects, and more. Contact the organizer(s) if you want to volunteer to speak at a meeting or recommend speakers. Contact the organizer(s) also if you are interested in providing a venue for meetings or in being a meetup sponsor, or if you would like to recommend possibilities for either.

Christoph

topics.name: Conquer that fear of public speaking

results.description:
Come to Toastmasters which is a safe place to practice practice your public speaking. Guests to meetings are welcome. To give a scheduled speech guests would need to join Toastmasters. We will announce various places at MIT where you can attend Toastmasters. 

Please view the Pages section for the meeting times and information of the various Toastmasters meetings.  

Here's a sample agenda for our meeting (most of Toastmasters at MIT follow similar agendas):

6:15 PM Setting up/Networking

6:30 PM President's Greeting and Club announcements

Welcome all to the MIT Tuesday Toastmasters.

Toastmaster's Welcome 

Introduces each role, its purpose, and the person who will perform the role.

Humorist/Joke

Starts the meeting on a light-hearted note.

Word of the Day

Encourages each of us to add a new word to our vocabularies. Challenge us to use the new word spontaneously.

Thought of Day

Club member gives short thought of the day.

Scheduled Speeches 

Club members give the speeches that they've scheduled and prepared in advance using the guidelines from one of the Toastmasters International communication manuals.

Table Topics

Our meeting's Topicsmaster provides our members and guests with an opportunity for demonstrating and honing their skills for impromptu speaking.

General Evaluator's Introduction 

Introduces evaluation team members and evaluate the evaluators and the meeting in general.

Speech Evaluations 

Club members provide helpful, supportive feedback to each of the scheduled speaker in a positive and friendly manner.

Ah-Counter's Report

Ah-counter reports how many filler-words and false starts were used by each participant, to raise speakers' awareness of these instances and to encourage improvement. 

Timer's Report

Timer reports speaking times of all major speaking roles to encourage members learn to accomplish tasks within set time limits.

Toastmasters Closing Remarks

President

Ask for volunteers for roles and speeches for the next week.

Please visit our website for more information.

http://web.mit.edu/personnel/toastmasters/
results.name: Toastmasters MIT

A group for Asian men to discuss sex, masculinity, culture, politics, and racial identity with a focus on self-improvement in a global society lacking a positive identity for Asian men. 

We may all walk the path of improvement, going to the gym 3 times a week, studying hard for exams, working hard in our careers, getting our dating life in order, but at some point, we all realize that we can't do it alone. Synergy - the belief that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. By joining us, you will connect with like-minded Asian men who will serve as both mentors to look up to and mentees to pass on your knowledge and expertise. 

Look forward to fun, diverse activities like movie nights, eating at ethnic restaurants, and simply hanging out at someone's place to discuss life strategies. All Asian men welcome, from East Asians to Southeast Asians, to South Asians.

results.description: The Dashing Whippets Running Team may be a newcomer to Boston, but we're no newcomer to the sport of running. We host group runs open to runners of all experience and ability levels and provide training plans for a variety of local races. Whatever your running or fitness goals, we welcome you to come run with us.

results.description: Less Stuff? Why? More Joy. Less CO2. More Time. Less Landfills. More Clarity. Less Expense. More Calm. Less Work. More Space. Less Stress. Less Stuff! This group is for people who want to change their relationship with stuff, who want to let go of the excess things and identify what is really important to them and make a positive impact in the world. It is hard on our own. We meet because we can learn from and encourage each other. Together it is easier. Gabriel Baldwin, group founder, has been working with clients since 2014 after his personal journey of letting go of stuff enabled him to majorly downsize his housing situation, move on from a 'good' job that wasn't serving him to pursue his passions while having a blast along the way.
results.name: Less Stuff, More Joy - Boston

results.description:
Welcome to the “Single's Life Journey – A Higher Love Singles Group” This is not your average Singles group. Here we will talk about the things that most people are afraid to talk about. So please read carefully before you decide to join.

Being Single shouldn't mean being alone.

The Heart and Purpose of this group is to explore the Single’s life journey. This group is where we can come together to reflect on each and every aspect of being Single, express our true authentic emotions (painful, shameful, joyful and all) and support each other in creating a fulfilled holistic life - emotionally, financially, intellectually, spiritually and practically. We will also look into information that will help us to create a genuine-sacred-spiritual partnership. There will be several meetups on various different topics and we will have market experts in those areas come and share their expertise with us. This is our safe place to be.


Who is this group for:

·  Single Heterosexual, Single Gay, Single Lesbian, Single Divorced, Single Widowed

·  All ages and ethnicities welcome

·  People who are ready to go deep emotionally and spiritually

·  People who are ready for spirituality, healing, growth and transformation

·  People who are ready and willing to be honest and vulnerable

·  People who are honest and committed

·  People who are interested in creating a genuine tribe to belong to


Who is this group NOT for:

·  People who are not ready for deep conversations and transformations

·  People who are just cruising for dates

·  People who just want to meet other single people

·  People who are looking to kill their free time

·  People who RSVP but then don’t show up --- After 2 no shows you will be removed from the group.


Some of the topics that we will talk about:

·  How does it really feel to be single?

·  What social stigma do we face in being single?

·  What familial or cultural pressures do we face

·  Do you have a genuine community that you belong to?

·  How can we release the Shame and Pain of being single

·  How can we invoke our Divine Power and Purpose within 

·  Vacation, Holidays – Nightmare or Fun?

·  Home ownership process for a Single person

·  Financial stability for a Single person

·  Can you create a family if you are single

·  How does our Familial and Ancestral issues block us in love

·  Past lovers and relationships – Do we just surgically remove them from our heart?

·  Lessons from our past relationships

·  Become Happy Now instead of Happily Ever-After 

·  Create our own genuine tribe and friendships

·  How do you create a Higher, Deeper, Sacred Love relationship


What does being single mean to you? Does this sound familiar -- You often feel like you don’t fit in, like you're out of place, like something is wrong with you. All your friends are married or coupled up. Social and Family events are not fun. Even with all your professional success, something is still missing... In this group we'll explore how to let go of the shame of being single, how you can regain your freedom and purpose. How you can take control of your narrative. How to plant your own roots and create your own tribe. How you can start being Happy NOW.
results.name: Single's Life Journey

Sudbury Valley Trustees (SVT) is a regional land trust, protecting and caring for land and wildlife habitat in 36 communities between Boston and Worcester. SVT currently has almost 3000 members.  Learn more at www.svtweb.org

Join SVT staff and volunteers in exploring a variety of conservation areas in the MetroWest. Both land and water-based activities are offered year-round, including trail walks, group bicycling tours, family outings, environmental education programs, snow shoeing, and more. 

Registration is required for all outings at svtweb.org/programs. 

Meetup members must be at least 18 years old. While family-friendly activities may be posted, any children present must be supervised by a parent or guardian.

results.description:
The Leader's Compass Group of Boston is an affiliation of professionals who are leaders in their businesses, organizations, communities, churches, and families. Their passions have them on paths to lead and grow themselves and those around them during each of their unique but influential journeys. Join us as you move closer to your north star and model the way for others. “Leadership is not about titles, positions or flowcharts. It is about one life influencing another. A leader knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way." ~ John C. Maxwell

As the group membership escalates rapidly, opportunities for meetups will arise. In the meantime, we have a solid core of today's influencers, who not only want to learn and grow but want to lead and grow others.

A 1-hour, bi-weekly conference call will deliver 10-15 minutes of leadership expertise from my mentor and friend, John C. Maxwell, followed by an open forum where we will unpack any one of the many principles John teaches in his talks, books, and in life. 

Are you ready? 

To Infinity . . . and Beyond! ~ Buzz Lightyear

It's also a great way to get your feet wet if you are exploring something new. Prices vary based on required materials, space rental cost, and preparation time. Workshops are held at 45 Mt. Auburn St. in Cambridge.

results.name: Settlers of Catan in Lexington, MA

results.description:
Does TensorFlow have the potential to become the engine behind most successful consumer and industrial products of the next 10-20 years? 

Absolutely! A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) train more computers to teach themselves by sifting through massive amounts of data coming out of all sorts of places

b) make these computers available through an API to provide a high-quality answer to anyone who is in need. 

Why? Because everyone in need deserves the right answer. 

So.... why don't we standardize & democratize the field with and around TensorFlow, and help change the world!?

What. We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of TensorFlow, its use cases and applications.

How. Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things TensorFlow:

• How-To's & Best Practices

• Tutorials

• Models

• Algorithms

• Multi-GPU Autoscaling in the cloud

• Tools & Integrations

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world around us, and how others make predictive APIs and  applications 

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. 

Because everyone in need deserves the right answer.

You are welcome:)
results.name: TensorFlow Boston

results.description:
This is a friendly and active social group for Queer women of all ages in the Boston area. We are dedicated to creating fun and exciting monthly dance events for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Queer women who love to dance. Our events will feature a mix of popular social ballroom and club-style dancing to the latest Top 40 hits. Each party will begin with a dance lesson taught by professional teachers. On occasion, a live band will play music to accompany the dancing. We are reviving the tradition of the legendary gay women’s dance parties that set the Boston women’s night scene ablaze for almost a decade back in the 90’s. Our first two parties took place in the same nostalgic venue: The Sons of Italy hall in Winchester, MA. More events are scheduled at the beautiful and spacious VFW hall in Melrose next to the Melrose Highlands commuter rail station. Other suitable venues are also under consideration for future dances. 

We certainly hope that you will enjoy the dance events that we are providing for queer women. We are looking for active members who will participate in our events. We want a real-world dance community to bring to life our virtual, online meetup. We are striving to create memorable nights filled with great music, socializing in a relaxed atmosphere, and good times. Our varied playlist will cover music from different eras. 

So turn it on, crank it up and let your rainbow flag fly. Please join our events and spread the word!

Dawn & Lena
results.name: Queer Women Dance Night Out

results.description: Hi! Do you live or work near Breakheart Reservation and sometimes run the loop, visit the outdoor gym or use the lovely trails in the park? Let's trail run on a consistent basis at Breakheart and the Middlesex Fells Reservations several times a week, meet new people , make new friends and get in excellent shape together. All levels welcome!

results.description:
Our main objective is to provide affordable and well organized pick up or drop in Amateur Team Sports games (soccer, basketball, volleyball, hockey, shinny, flag football, badminton, dodgeball,etc.) to the community. We are passionate about sports and we want to bring you the games at your convenience. If you don't have time to commit to a team, if you can't pay expensive fees to play in Team leagues in the city, if you are not available for the strict schedule required by team leagues, if you want to show up at your convenience and play without being tied to a specific team , then we have the answer: Our organisation is a Competitive Co-Ed Drop in Sports League for classy, respectful and open mind ladies and gentlemen who play for fun, for the love of the game, and more importantly to make good friends for life, exercise and stay sharp and healthy.

To participate,

- Register here on meetup and join our group

- Select the games you are interested in and RSVP, then show up on the field on game day with your fees and play.

- Read and accept the rules and accept the waiver at http://ShowUpAndPlaySports.com

- Some games required a fee to cover field rentals and organization and you can save money by subscribing for the month at http://ShowUpAndPlaySports.com/subscribe

Find more organized pick up games anywhere near you at http://ShowUpAndPlaySports.com
Download our Amateur Sports Hub and Pick Up Games Locator called Djamga at iTunes or Google play store.
results.name: ShowUpAndPlaySports Boston

results.description:
Calling all sewists looking for inspiration! I sew because I love fashion, fabrics, and making beautiful and unique items to wear or admire in my home. I work in technology having nothing to do with fashion and I love the shift into creativity when I'm not working.  I'm not a teacher and this meet-up is designed purely to build camaraderie and motivate one another to keep working on our projects. 

We'll sew in one another's homes (I live in Belmont), as well as sewing centers like Gather Here in Somerville--where you can rent space, Marie's Sewing Center in Woburn--where they have monthly Friday night sewing cafes, and Grey's Fabric and Notions in Boston. results.description:
이 그룹은 한국 엄마들만을 위한 모임입니다. 꼭 한국인이고 엄마인 사람만 가입할수 있습니다. 통역이나 비지니스를 위한 연락은 사절합니다. 기본적인 한국어가 모임 활동에 도움이 됩니다.

results.description:
We get together to create community of people who share the skill of empathic abilities. You don't have to convince others of your abilities as everyone in the group has those abilities.

Let's discuss the desirable side of having these skills and share discoveries how to improve them.  Current written scientific information on mirror-touch synesthesia is about being uncomfortable with these abilities.  Having emapthic abilities is a skill and a skill can be improved and modified to fit the need.  Let's share discoveries that work.

Recent publications on the topic of mirror-touch synesthesia state that those having these abilities don't know how to feel sensations in their own body.  I find that the empathic abilities can be fine tuned so that you choose what to experience, yourself or others.

We get together, share the good side of empathy, pass on insights to better understand the phenomenon to others.

We will start each group with laughter.  How to allow laughter is a skill.  It gets you in the mood not to be overly serious.
results.name: mirror-touchsynesthesia

Are you someone in your 20's or 30's interested in volunteering? Do you want to better the lives of those that are less fortunate? Do you have ideas on how/where we can volunteer? Then this group is for you. We volunteer locally to bring a little happiness to people. We want to introduce new ways/strategies/ideas to help those who are less fortunate. We need to be creative, think outside the box, look at the big picture and work on the roots of why people end up suffering. If we can make a difference at the grassroots level, hopefully we can make our city, country and this world a better place!

We will try to do volunteer work every Sunday. In addition, we will meet a couple of times a month to discuss strategy, brain storm, discuss bigger problems and outline potential solutions to each of those problems (Ex. a focus on education from an early age will result in productive future citizens. How can we increase the importance of education in low-income, blue collar families. How do we measure the results of our efforts?). That's just an example, but there are tons of issues like that affecting people.

Will you join in me in making the lives of others better?

results.description:
"FRIENDS HELPING FRIENDS MAKE BUSINESS CONNECTIONS" - J.Z.


Calling all Entrepreneurs, Business Owners and those who dream of running their own venture!


If you desire to expand your business network, make more friends, find new customers and become a leader in your community, we have a fun and informal social networking group that is just right for you.


We'll have monthly meetings at coffee shops or neighbourhood bars in and around town to connect with others & learn "best practice" sales, marketing, finance and time management tactics and strategies from your city’s top entrepreneurs.


The Smart Success Business Network is a community run by volunteers with 101 Meetup groups in 101 cities across Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and United States. 


MOST EVENTS ARE FREE AND ALL BUSINESS OWNERS & MANAGERS ARE WELCOME.


No attendance commitment required.
• You can arrive and leave on your schedule.
• No elevator pitches in front of the group required.
• Informal bar/restaurant meetings in the evenings.
• Most meetups are between Tuesdays & Thursdays.
• No long sit down meals next to strangers. 


 Our mission is to encourage business success by recruiting small business owners to give group talks to their peers, potential customers and suppliers and new entrepreneurs to share their expertise and offer words of support and encouragement to their community. 


 We are also known as a "Pay it Forward" group. You might find your ideal client/customer here in your first meetup but it's more likely you will meet someone who can benefit from goods & services offered by your friends.


By networking to help other business owners and recommending products or services by other members, the benefits of increased sales accumulate to everyone in the group.


Benefits of networking with us:


You will learn how to avoid unprofitable markets, attract the right customers, block negative critical thinking, be both effective and efficient, understand cash flow and much more.


Though powerful stories and proven strategies, you will learn how to boldly harness your creative force, break free of fear and get your life and business aligned with your values and the market's needs.


With the right knowledge and support, you can design a life and business that embodies strength and boldness that you know you are capable of. See you at one of our meetings soon.
results.name: Smart Success Business Network of Boston

topics.name: Making a True Change in Our Local Politics

results.description:
"You never change something by fighting the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete."  - Buckminster Fuller

Town Hall is an old New England tradition going back four centuries, that involved true democratic participation of all citizens in their community's social and political decisions.  

In  the 21st century in Newton Massachusetts we do not have a system of democratic participation. Newton politics is run by an insular political clique who do not truly welcome citizen participation. They view any citizens who attempt to participate in the political process as a nuisance. 

The politicians will perform a pantomime of allowing citizen participation, but it's just a sham, and they will end up doing whatever they intended to do all along, after they finish their charade or pretending to listen to feedback from the public. 

Newton's politicians do not care what is best for the community, and they certainly don't care what any of the citizens think about anything. What they care about is their own positions of power, the business dealings that are at the root of all their decisions, and the status symbols of their titles.

If you've ever attempted to get involved in Newton politics at any level you will probably recognize the truth of the above paragraph. You may also have come to the realization of the futility of expecting to ever be able to change the way things are run in Newton politics.

The idea of NewTown Hall is to start from scratch, to scrap the established way of running decisions, and try to envision what a truly democratic and reasonable form of local government would be. This must be a form of interaction where everyone has the right to be heard, and truly listened to, and where decisions are based on reason, sense, logic, and commitment to what is genuinely best for the community.

The manners of behavior and procedure that are conducted by the current political system must be discarded, because these behaviors and procedures clearly do not work in favor of the goals of true democracy. These behaviors are designed only to maintain the power dynamics of the politicians, to keep them powerful and you powerless.

To begin with, then, we must dispense with the insincere behaviors of handshaking, gavel-wielding, and applause. 

NewTown Hall must create a model of how local government ought to be conducted. We will develop this on our own, as ordinary citizens, without the participation of the politicians. We won't need to beg for their permission or approval, because this is something we will do on our own, separate from their procedures and outside of their jurisdiction to dictate to us how we can and cannot act.

NewTown Hall will be an alternative, ad hoc, non-binding self-government system.


For more on the concept of Buckminster Fuller:

http://www.davidmcelroy.org/?p=18991

"We can't defeat the existing system; we must build a better one instead".
results.name: NewTown Hall

Projects Completed, Planed and
Scheduled: L2A re-amp box from DIY.RE Teacher: Peterson Goodwyn DOD 250 Plus from Clone Your Own: Teachers: John Snyder T-47 from Microphone-Parts.com: Teacher: Tony Norton and more.

SSL TB Compression Colour Hack: Team Leader: Monte McGuire TBA for Colour Hack: Team Leader: John Snyder Bookshelf Speaker: TBA CP5 PreAmp 500 Series PreAmp: Teacher: Peterson Goodwyn Dub Siren noise marker by Analog Craftsman: Teacher: Tony Norton Current List of Panelists and Experts:
Peterson Goodwyn: Founded DIY.RE diyrecordingequipment.com in 2010 and started selling the LINE2AMP Re-amplifier kit, designed specifically to introduce beginners to the world of DIY. Bob Hertig: Co-Founded U-Turn Audio in 2012 and raised over $100,000 on Kickstarter. And Sold 5,000 inexpensive , HIFI turntable in 2014. John W. Snyder: Currently in his second year as a PhD student at Boston University in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering. He is Chief Engineer at Electronic Audio Experiments. Tony Norton: Founded Analog Craftsman in 2008 where he is designing, modifying, and building modular analog synthesizer modules including circuits and user interfaces for original products. Michael Blackmer: Michael's experience in product and circuit design may be overshadowed by his experience with DBX, Electric Lady, Earthworks Audio and as an acoustician and repair tech. Patrick Grenham: Aside from maintaining the analog equipment the Soul Shop. He does tech work on tube recording gear and custom builds amplifiers and recording gear on a limited basis for outside players and engineers. Neil Miller: Designing electronics for mass produced products by Ovation Guitars, Fishman Transducers, and Scholz Research. His designs include electronics for the Rockman headphone amp and the original Parker Fly Guitar. results.description:
StackiLab Boston is a meetup for those interested in learning about Stacki, server provisioning, configuration management, and DevOps. This group is for everyone- both Stacki users and beginners to Stacki- you don't need to have any prior experience! Stacki is an open source CentOS/RHEL bare metal provisioning tool that can take your servers from bare hardware (or virtual hardware) to working Linux, ready to install applications. Stacki does this at scale, so deploying 1000+ servers is no more complex than deploying one. Once your servers are installed with Stacki, you can augment them with configuration tools like Puppet, Chef, Salt, CFEngine, Ansible, etc. 

Join the Stacki community: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/stacki

Download Stacki: http://www.stacki.com/

Stacki documentation: https://github.com/StackIQ/stacki/wiki

Follow Stacki on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Stacki
results.name: Stacki Boston

Note: This group is meant for those between the ages of 21 and 39. Membership is limited to those who fall within this age range.

Code of Conduct: I expect that all members treat the leadership team and other members with utmost respect. You will be expected to follow the Platinum Rule: treat others as they would want to be treated. This rule also extends to any staff or volunteers we interact with.

Attendance Policy: If you RSVP "yes" to an event, you are expected to attend. If for any reason you are unable to attend, please change your RSVP to "no". For events with a waitlist, at least 24 hours notice is requested when RSVPing "no" in order to be fair to those on the waitlist. No-shows will not be tolerated. Three no-shows will result in immediate removal from the group.

Photo Policy: Your photo must contain a clear view of your face. We must be able to recognize you at events based on your photo.

The leadership team reserves the right to remove any member for failure to adhere to these policies.

results.description: Are you searching for meaning in your life? Have you ever felt happiness in your life... ...never lasts? This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions. Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life. We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness. I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance! Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location. In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy. Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering

In 2016 and beyond, let us be willing to throw off preconceived notions, ideas, and methods. Let's be willing to start from scratch, to scrap what has come before, and find new pathways. results.description:
Boston-centric lightsaber stage combat group. We meet to develop, practice, and perform stage combat using lightsaber props; our mission is to provide a safe and fun performance for the audience while having a ball of fun ourselves!

Core values: 

1, safety safety safety. You are responsible for your safety, your partner's safety, and the audience's safety.

2, inclusiveness. We welcome everyone and expect everyone to contribute to a welcoming environment: abusive, insulting, harassing, or intimidating behavior will not be tolerated.

3, sharing. Come to learn, come to teach! We all have experience from different walks of life: come share what you know and learn from others. If you are here to work with people to make both of you look awesome at stage combat, you're in the right place. Those who want to pump up their ego about how cool a fighter they are, need not attend.

This group is focused on stage combat, which is a different creature than actual combat techniques. Also, this group is neutral about cosplay: some people might wish to have costumes that are 501st Legion/Rebel Legion approved, some people may want to do crossovers, some people may have no interest in cosplay. Lastly, we are not an RP group, although many of our members are heavily involved in other RP groups. We're just here to focus on the stage combat involving lightsabers.

FAQ:

"Do I need a lightsaber to attend?"

Nope! We have loaners.

"How often do you meet?"

Every Thursday night. We are currently holding practices at MIT's campus. http://whereis.mit.edu/?go=m34 We are slowly moving towards having additional Saturday practices for those who can't come during the week, but that may not happen for awhile.

"Are there any fees?"

No charges for anything.

"Where can I find more info?"

Our homepage is www.bostonjedi.org and we also have a Facebook group you can join: https://www.facebook.com/groups/768206489869545/
results.name: Boston Jedi

results.description:
Hi, my name is Renat. I started this meetup group because I want to help OpenAI fulfill its mission (I’m not affiliated with the OpenAI non-profit organization). When I was in college, the world of artificial intelligence fascinated me. So I was applying Neural Nets to data sets generated by e-commerce websites (using Kohonen’s Self Organizing Maps).

It was 1999. Looking back, I realize that my research is a joke compared to what you can do today.

What becomes possible tomorrow is super exciting and scary at the same time. That is why I decided to contribute my time and evangelize importance of this non-profit organization among artificial intelligence enthusiasts in Boston. Specifically, I will be finding and securing physical locations where members of this group could meet in person, share and discuss ideas.

If you care to help - drop me a line with any ideas or suggestions you might have. Or simply say hello and introduce yourself because I would like to learn about you and the projects you are working on! See you soon!

Disclaimer: This Meetup group is not affiliated with the OpenAI non-profit organization. This Meetup group does not own the OpenAI trademark; this Meetup has no affiliation, connection or association with such third party; Such third party has not approved nor sponsored this Meetup group's use of the trademark in any way.
results.name: OpenAI Boston
